reviews.review:
This is for all the people flying in from Honolulu on Hawaiian Airlines that land at 6 am and cannot check into their hotel and don't want to start losing all their money right away. 

Go here. Jump in the hot bath and then the steam sauna. Go upstairs and lay on the hot stones or chill in the cold room. Sit back and relax on the recliner. I even fall asleep there for like an hour. 

This is the best way to unwind after a long flight. I know they have massages there too but the $20 entrance fee is all I need to get me ready to party for the next three days.

Spacious and big

The employees are kind and helpful if you need anything 

I didn't try the food but people did not seem to think it was bad. 

The pools are about 4 ft deep which was nice but are medium size. 

They could use a little cleaning inside the showers but for the most part it was clean. 

Everyone is pretty respectful and quiet. 

Wish it was 24hrs, save money by not going to a hotel
This place is awesome! Really help for relax the body after a tired days , will come back!

Great experience!  Went here with my girlfriends on a Groupon deal.  Will definitely be going back.

Five stars if they had cool towels for you in the sauna areas.

I used to come here a lot but now I live very far from here, I hadn't been here for 4 - 5 years. Finally after 4-5 years, I came back here today. I was worried about this place reading the recent reviews saying this place went down. Had to check it out because I was missing getting Korean body scrubs. My opinion, this place neither went down nor went up. 
I've been to a couple of Korean spa (NJ and CA) and this place is my least favorite but can't get fussy because I think this is the only place in Vegas I can get authentic Korean scrubs. (Hey, let me know if you know any other place in Vegas ;-)!)
Not the cleanest. Not relaxing or fancy at all. I would never come here unless I'm getting Korean scrub from Korean lady. I saw a couple of girls wearing swim suits and just enjoying the saunas. If you are embarrassed to get naked in front of people, I would not recommend this place. Go to Qua bath or Bellagio or Wynn. More expensive but I bet you get your money's worth. Unlimited beverages, nice amenities, fresh fruits and etc... 
Someone said they don't speak English, but everyone spoke perfect English at the front desk. (guys and a girl)
When I was there, there was not a hair dryer. Bring hair brush. Bring your own flip flops to walk around the facility. Bring extra towels if necessary (they only give you one hard bath towel and a face towel.) Low quality shampoo, conditioner and shower gel available. Bring your own facial soap. 
I will be back even though I'm not crazy about this place because there's no better scrub than Korean scrub!!! (My opinion.)

I was looking for a Korean Spa in Las Vegas. The Groupon offers really allowed me to try this place out. It's rather a "typical" Korean spa format. 

I enjoyed my time here, especially on a Monday around 4p.m. There were few people. I think there could be some room for improvement, as they do not have extra towels available once you get inside the spa. I get that it's probably to cut cost of towel cleaning, but other Korean spas I've gone to have ample towels inside as well. 

I'll definitely be back.
This spa / massage parlor was incredible. Angela was awesome and this is the best massage I ever received. Whenever I'm back in Vegas I'm calling Imperial Health and Spa.

This place represents one of the best deals in Vegas! Amazing, relaxing experience to be had. Such creativity used in creating the different relaxation rooms and areas, and the entrance fee of $20 just can't be beat! I MIGHT have deducted 1 star because: 1. They really should have more signs letting people know to SHOWER after leaving any steam room, before entering the pools and 2) Some signs telling LOUD people to be quiet- to promote an environment of relaxation. However the price and experience are both so good, I'll leave it at 5 stars. Sublime!

My mother and I enjoyed our great experience at the Korean bathhouse. It was a different kind of a"Spa" that we didn't expected.  Overall, we will be coming back again before the end of the year.   I think if u want a different experience of a Korean style bathhouse, u should give it a try.

I don't go to spa's too often, but this one was pretty nice and clean.  They had a decent locker room and many different options to hang out and sweat.  Dry sauna's, steam room, herbal steam room, cold spa, hot spa, clay balls to lay in, tomb style clay rooms, yoga area, sleep area, lounge area with TV's, cafe, water accessible everywhere.  Got a massage too and my masseuse was cool.  Didn't feel uncomfortable and she got the job done.  Staff was super friendly as well.  Overall this was a good experience and I may make it a regular visit on vegas trips.  If all you care about is spa access, check groupon.  Seems like they always have a deal.
Very new and clean.  The facility is excellent.  Definitely would be coming back everytime I visit Vegas.

If your not shy, this place is the perfect answer to people who enjoy a spa experience. 
This is the place to go, to unwind and relax for a few hours, especially if you are on a budget. 
I love love love, that for only $20 a day you can stay as long as you like and use all of their general services which include soaking pools (hot, warm, ice), wet saunas and dry saunas, yoga room, lounge areas with tv, and a small cafeteria which also includes a small terrace. 
 
Beside that you can for additional charges get a full body wrap, massage, facial etc.

This is my little oasis get away!

Checked this place out couple of times. I like the sauna. Really makes me sweat and open my pores. Then, I have a choice of going to hot tub or cold tub after sauna. The upstairs heating rooms are great for relaxation. They also have a food place upstairs where you can get something to eat if you want. Variety of korean foods. Front desk staff sometimes friendly and sometimes not.

I love this place! My girlfriend and I have come here twice after a long weekend in the sin city. Great place to detoxify after a drunken party weekend in Vegas!! The herbal steam room is amazing; you can really feel it clearing you out and relaxing your muscles. All of the dry saunas in the common area are great, especially the red clay ball room. 

All of the showers, saunas, and pools are clean an well kept. Even though I'm walking around in front of strangers in the nude, I still feel really comfortable. Everyone is nice and accommodating. If in doubt as to where to go next in a Korean Spa just watch the others or just ask!

I Love This Place! The Sauna's are great!! They have 3 coed saunas in the 2nd floor & 3 same gender in the locker room on the first floor. I felt like i was in Jr High again in the locker room. If u don't like being in your birthday suit then I suggest u bring a bikini.  Its kind like a bath house Ive been told. Its open 24 hours, seven days a week. Locker room has 3 jacuzzi - Hot, Warm & Cold. Its a great place to relax with your other half, family & friends. I'm going again this week with my friends!!!

We visited this place a year a go. Natalia was working with me, and another guy was working with my husband. The massage was great. I really enjoyed how Natalia managed to get me relaxed, she is a real professional. My husband was also very happy. It's not so easy to massage him, because he has a thick skin and tough muscles, but he felt refreshed and happy after the massage. After a year we still sometimes discuss how wonderful it was to visit this place.

I have to rewrite my review as to how things are going.  Since we bought the package  deal I will have to reevaluate my initial review.  I am happy they are open again I forgot how relaxing this place really is.  I enjoy going over there and spending the afternoon soaking, scrubbing, and lounging.  

The Wi-Fi was working today so I was truly able to enjoy my afternoon so I am a happy girl.  I also went and bought a bunch of fun bath scrubs and brought it along this time and I like that better then just plain salt, mine smells better and has oils in it for my skin so that problem is solved also.  The restaurant was open today so I got some spicy tofu soup.  They still do not have a chairs in the movie room tho sad for me. 

So all in all I am happy they are open and will continue to enjoy going here even if there is bumps in the road...

I go to lots of Korean spas in Orange County and LA. This is the worst Korean spa I've been to. The management is obviously very stingy with spending money on any kind of upkeep. There are signs asking you not to use the towels. There's even a sign asking you to limit how much water you drink. There is an angry sign about a guest that damaged something with how much the repair cost and threatening the other guests with a fine of that amount if caught doing the thing that damaged the equipment. All of these signs didn't add to my relaxation or enjoyment. 

The facility is in very poor condition. Things are broken and aged. I understand it might be expensive to renovate, but I see no excuse for not cleaning. It had that smell of a wet place that isn't kept very clean. There were spots of gray water on the floors in the wet area. 

The price is quite reasonable in terms of price. The pools, steam and sauna were in working order. If you just want to soak a little and shower, and you aren't worried too much about cleanliness, it's probably worth the $20 entrance fee. If you want to really relax and enjoy a clean, pampering environment, I would pay more and go somewhere else. 

I didn't visit the coed area so I can't comment on that area.

I am only giving this spa 2 stars because I have had problems there. I have written to the management an email and never received an answer. I am a breast cancer survivor and enjoy going to the spa.  However this is the problem... I am not comfortable being naked in front of other people after having 5 years of surgery on my breast. They don't seem to understand that I would like to use the jacuzzi, hot tub and cold tub but prefer to wear my bathing suit. I always get threatened by the cleaning lady that she is going to tell the management that I am not naked. I tell her that I am not going to expose my ugly body to anyone. If you're comfortable being naked this spa was nice.

The best Korean Spa I've been to by far.  So many different rooms to try and they even have TWO different type of steam rooms.  
I love their clay room, jade room and ice room.   Super clean and relaxing atmosphere.

The facility is clean, quiet and peaceful.  A couple of the rooms were out of order, but it was okay. Spent the whole afternoon, very relaxing, and felt I lost track of time today when I was there.  Good food, good price! The staff was courteous, and friendly. I will sure come back next time to try out those rooms.
This place is simply amazing!! total body and mind relaxation at its best!! It actually feels great to walk around naked and not care, totally liberating.

This place was pretty clean and nice. They've got three pools, and few saunas(steams, dry, herbal). We went there in the morning, so there were not many people. If you don't want a crowd, go there early like when they opens at 8am.

But I noticed that there are lots of first-timers. and I feel like they need to read this.

[ INSTRUCTION TO A KOREAN SPA ]
-if you've never been to a Korean spa, you'd be lost what to do, what to wear, where to go. They don't tell you. I saw many first-timers wearing swimsuits or wondering around in the bathrobe in the sauna/bath area. If you are too shy to be naked in front of people, this is not a place for you.

***IF YOU'VE NEVER BEEN TO A KOREAN SPA, YOU SHOULD CAREFULLY READ THIS SECTION BELOW***

Things you should bring
-change of clothes
-skin care product 
-facial lotion/cream
-razor (they have it too)
-tooth brush (they have it too)

 When you get there, they'll give you a key, towels(small, medium, large), co-ed clothes.(you should also ask to get slippers at the front desk too.) Then, you go in to the locker room, take your shoes off, change to the sandal. Go to your locker(the number on your key). And this is the part most Americans don't know to do - GET NAKED! You don't take a shower/bath with clothes on at home, right? Same thing here, just take your clothes off. Nobody cares. Take a small or medium size towel(the large towel are to dry yourself after the bath, so save that - I saw some people hide themselves with a large towel to go in to the bath, and later realize that she doesn't have a towel to dry herself). Go into the bathroom. They have a area for shower. Make sure to wash yourself before going into the bath or sauna! They have shampoo/conditioner and soap, but if you are picky bring your own. Once you are done washing, tie your hair and go take a bath or go to sauna.
Ok, you are done with sauna and bath. Now you can get out and change to the cloth they give you to go to the co-ed area. Co-ed area is upstairs, there is a stairs in the locker room. DON'T GO UP WITHOUT CLOTHES! Upstairs is CO-ED area. Co-ed area has cafe, lots of couches, variety of rooms - they have different health properties. People go in there and sleep or just lay for a while. some of the rooms are pretty hot, so don't stay too long. Keep drinking water!

Enjoy!

I was going to hangout with my friends but we didn't know what to do so I wanted to come to this place. It was a $20 entrance fee and they gave me a shirt, pants, towel, and a locker key. The lockers were nice and huge so I really enjoyed that, along with there being a couch and several sinks in the women's room. Another thing that I loved about this place was that if you walked upstairs, there's the coed area. Maybe I need some getting used to but I did not like how you had to be naked in order to go into the hot tub. All of the rooms were amazing. Make sure to wear sandals when entering the Red Clay Room or the Jade Room! I didn't feel as relaxed. My favorite thing about Imperial Health and Spa is that it's Korean based! I would try out other spas before coming back to this one, though.

Here on a Sunday night. Place has a good layout with lots of areas. Coed area is huge with lots of seating. You can tell the place is a bit dated. Men's spa are was really gross and hadn't been cleaned for a while. 1 sauna was broken, other two has mold grow. Shower are had standing grey water on ground. No towels were available. 
Got just a simple raven and was fine. Nothing too exciting.
Been to multiple other korean spas in LA and San Diego.  This place has potential, but upkeep was horrible.
The facilities aren't as nice as other Korean spas I have been to. The services were great though!

I was there on last Saturday and it was great!. I was a little concern about the bad reviews but no way this place is a hidden gem.  I bought my ticket through living social and I got two tickets for the price of one!. It was cheap and the local, rooms and food was great. My girlfriend told me that it is the same of the ones in NY. After the hot rooms (salt, herbs, clay, etc) we took the cold room and ordered some food. The chicken soup had a entire chicken on it. It was enough for the 2 of us. The food is not cheap but it worth the price. I recommend it.
We absolutely  love going here! If you want  to relax in a nice,clean environment this is certainly the place to go to.
Cant wait to get a massage from Emily....she is the bestest at deep tissue.  Its amazing.  I totally love this place

Very nice place. location is a little bit difficult to find.
Good deal from groupon for day pass.
I spend 3 hours at there.
The massage and VIP services are quite expensive.
One body massage already over 100 per hour.
I will come back again.

Everything you want from a Korean spa and an amazing red clay room that will blow you mind.  But the reason I felt moved enough to write a review is because they have a wold class massage therapist there named Marisol. Incredible

This beautiful  peaceful Zen like Korean spa is one of Las Vegas best little secret. The spa provides all your amenities such as spa t-shirt and shorts, rubber slippers. towels, multiple hair products, oral hygiene products and a key for your private locker. All for a regular reasonable price of  $20. Specials offers of $150 for 10 visits or try Groupon, Living Social or Amazon for $12 per visit, wow! 
Upstairs is co-ed so, you can make this a couples spa retreat enjoying all the different types of dry saunas, the ice room, a Korean restaurant serving food and drinks, lounge chairs and TV for relaxing and a yoga room with a instructor on a giant TV if you care to follow along.  Some of the unique  dry saunas include; Jade, red clay coves, Himalayan salt and the bed of rocks or red clay balls to lay on. I found that if you alternate between the hot dry saunas then use the ice room back and forth is a much more enjoyable experience. The spa provides  free Wi-Fi codes and outlet so you can use your electrons or listen to your music while you meditate. 

Downstairs is a separate spa area for the men and women. Downstairs are the lockers, Korean type showers, hot and cold whirlpools, herbal, regular and salt steam rooms and bathrooms. The staff keeps the spa very clean and they are friendly. 
Massages and body scrubs are offered for an additional fee. 

I love this place, I have been here twice and plan to return again.

I recently went here for the first time on the recommendation of my MT Patricia Medina.  As always her massage was off the charts wonderful, but the spa made it even better.  After being shown around I took time to relax and heal for several hours.  For a flat rate of $20 (and free if you book a massage with Patricia) it is a great value!
Great massage and day spa.  A bit off the strip but much more affordable.

Don't be fooled by the exterior because this Korean spa is totally a hidden jewel in Las Vegas.  It is one of my favorite places to spend literally the whole day in. Highly recommend for those that want to wind down and have rejuvinated skin. 

Like everyone has said the groupons really help if you are an avid visitor, otherwise it is $20 for all day general entrance.

They also have many different spa amenities available including massages, facials, manicure, pedicures, and more! The menu is right in the front and they are scheduled through availability. They also have masks and beauty products for sale in the front.  In addition, there is food available all day. Everything is charged through your key and is paid when you are leaving.

Definitely take your time here and enjoy every single moment you are there. Take a dip. Steam off. Take a nap. Have some food.  Then sweat it off! Have fun and go treat yourself as often as you can!

I must say that I was scared at first to go to this spa.  We were on a girls trip and one of the girls highly suggested this experience and boy am I glad she did!  After reading the reviews on this site, she picked this particular spa. 

I swear it was a religious experience.  We went into the jacuzzi first to loosen up and my little sweet faced masseur came in to get me.  She was wearing her 'uniform' of a bra and underwear.  Yep...either time to run or time to take the dive!  Now, if you are modest, this is not for you.  Usually I am, but I was warned before we went that if you don't want to get naked, don't go at all....but I decided to surrender to the experience.  Great decision.

First, I was taken into the room where my sweet little Jenny rubbed delicious smelling sugar all over my body.  Okay....98% of my body.  Again, you have to surrender to the experience.  lol.  Then, she put me in the sauna for about 10 minutes.  I was joined there by my 2 girlfriends where we sat there, in the buff, with melting sugar all over us.  Talk about bonding!  lol.  She took me back to the shower and washed my whole body.  We headed back into the room where she put some kind of volcanic ash or seaweed or something...and wrapped me in plastic and left me in the quiet for about 40 minutes.  Next, after I took another rinse, I went back to her table again where she gave me the best massage of my life, then a cold fresh cucumber facial....the cucumber was freshly smashed by her at some point...and it was ice cold.  Oh my gosh AMAZING.  And finally, after putting amazing lotion all over my body, she removed the face mask and WASHED MY HAIR.    

After this amazing experience, we proceed upstairs to the clay rooms.  One room had these awesome balls of hot clay that you lay in and just relax.  

The spa portion of our visit was about 2 hours.  We were there for about 4 and a half hours total and when we left, we could barely talk.  It was a great bonding experience.  And when it was all over, I hugged my little Jenny and told her I wanted to come back over and over again.

I was also excited to find out they had a location here in Fullerton, California!  So now I can go to the spa whenever I want to.  I will never go to Burke Williams ever again.  

AAAAhhhhhhhhh...heaven.  Highly recommended!!!  I am telling everyone about this experience and trying to take as many other friends as I can!  :)

It is ALL about the Aromatherapy Scrub & Massage at Imperial Health Spa. But brace yourself, bitches. There's no gentle, relaxing touch involved so if that's your thing, don't even bother reading any more of my review. The hearts and rainbows and jumping unicorns and rose petals are just not the type of things that transpire over at the Korean Spa. So if you're a bad ass like me and you're from the school that whatever doesn't kill you makes you stronger, do feel free to read on... 

They will scrub you within an inch of your life and elbow the shit out of knots in your back but it's sooo worth it! No pain no gain baby! Brunhilda from Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure has nothing on the chicks that work here! If you don't get that reference, don't feel bad. It's just some obscure, cheesy movie that I happen to have acted in so I wouldn't expect you to have any idea what I'm talking about. And if you do get it... I'm impressed! Extra cool points in my book for you!

Come earlier than your appointment time. Like half an hour early minimum. They want you to be human soup with the rest of the nudists that enjoy the facilities here pre-scrub/massage. Oh and jump into that steam room for a few too if you can handle it. I can't take it too long though. I get wayyy too hot! *insert cute boys sending me compliments like "Yeah, that's right, you ARE way too hot!" here*

My suggestion is to come here before an airbrush tanning session. Get all that dead skin off your body and then head over to see Terry over at Bronzed. But actually the ideal thing is to do this the day or two before because they put a bunch of hardcore moisturizer/oil on you which is not good to have on your skin before an airbrush tanning session because it will make it so the tanner doesn't stick and defeat the whole purpose of your doing the scrub in the first place.

They do just about everything that can be done to pamper you here during this treatment. And there are two different options. One's $125 and the other is $150. Only difference between the two is that the massage is a little longer longer. The Aromatherapy Scrub and Massage appointment goes as follows:

Your scrubber/massage lady comes and finds you in the steam room or jacuzzi. You go back with her and get completely nude. She scrubs the hell out of you as you contemplate your escape route and/or start thinking of a way you can start climbing the ceiling. She shows you all the nasty skin she has taken off of you and you're like, "Wow! I guess I definitely needed this! I swear I don't live in a cardboard box under a freeway overpass!" Then she washes you with this pineapple smelling soap and one of those poof things. This is one of my favorite parts of the treatment because the scent is very intense and smells amazing! After that they wash your hair for you and condition it while giving you a bit of a head massage. Then they seat you up and give you some soap for your face and have you go get in the shower while they clean up all your dead skin off the table so everything is nice and clean for the massage portion that is coming up next. After your shower, they hand you a towel and have you lay down on the table face down. Then they dry you off some more and begin the massage. After that they flip you over and massage a little more, then put a mask on your face. While the mask is drying, they massage your neck and shoulders. Then they peel the mask off and that's the end of your aromatherapy scrub and massage treatment. 

All in all it is a great experience that I recommend and partake in often. So if you see me running around naked 'round these parts, don't be surprised. And sorry dudes... it's not co-ed in the naked area although the men do have their own birthday suit section at this spa. No clue what goes on back there so you're on your own there, buddy. To all the ladies out there... Maybe say hi or something if you see me... Or not. Cuz that like might be awkward since we're like naked and stuff. I dunno... I'm pretty easygoing so if you don't mind, I won't. Your call either way, fellow yelpers. 

All I know is this... You will leave here glowing and looking fantastic, feeling like a new woman! This place is the bomb diggity and the sheer number of checkins I have listed above should speak volumes about how much I love this place!

3.5 stars
It was clean, lockers were big, they had a few dry sauna rooms that are co-ed, jacuzzi and steam rooms in the men and women's locker rooms. 
Nothing fancy but gets the job done.
Nice addition to Las Vegas.

Loved this place!!  Super cheap at $20 with lots of places to relax and recharge.  Highly recommend it.  Wet areas downstairs have jacuzzi, sauna and steam with a cold plunge to relax.

Upstairs area is coed requiring you to wear their outfit which was quite comfy.  Favorites upstairs were the clay ball room which I had never seen and I have been to spas all over the country.  Fridge room  was also a first for me but refreshing after heated areas.  

A few tips:  you only get one large towel when you check in so save that for your finishing shower. All the towels provided in the wet areas are too small to dry you off.  

If you are uncomfortable with nudity, this spa is not for you.  There are no private shower stalls or private dressing rooms.

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed but not much service; they basically hand you your stuff and point you to the door so go explore a genuine Korean style spa!!

When you first come into the area it seems to be in a kinda sketchy but once you get inside it's BEAUTIFUL!  Very High Class.  I felt like the richest man in all of Las Vegas.  We used a living social coupon for the place and I dare say we'll do it again.  

Once you check-in and pay there are 2 different locker rooms, male and female.  Connected to those locker rooms are showers, hot and cold jacuzzi pools, steam saunas, and salt saunas (my wife said the women's side had an herbal sauna; I didn't find one in the men's).  

The second level has 3 different heat sauna rooms: clay ball room, adobe clay room, jade and eucalyptus room, and an ice room. There is also a yoga room and a little restaurant. You could probably spend all day going in and out of the rooms.  They also offer massages, for a fee.  We didn't get the couples massage 'cause we're cheap, but everything else is amazing.  

All the patrons there were very nice and talkative, as were the workers.  If you need a day to relax and sweat out all the toxins, this is your place.  I plan on going back again and again.  I would have given 5 stars but the messages were pretty pricey.  Other than that great experience.

When you by a groupon for two or more they would give you a pass for the second visit.
Now if you have a groupon then they will not honor your second visit.

Salt room in mens is clothing required and the patched ceiling is coming down.

I brought my pass in for the second visit and they said it was void , even though it said it expired june 30th. They made me pay again!!!!

Mah-ni jo-ah hey-o! 

This place is awesome. Immaculately clean, with good towel/robe service. The rooms are well-lit and well-maintained. Salt scrubs, jade sauna, and clay ball therapy are some of the features. I love to relax in a warm room with soothing herbal smells all around me. 

My roommate and I always book the scrub, which is a cross between torture and a massage, and essentially rubs an entire layer of skin off of your body. The masseuse scrubs, kneads, and pounds every inch of your body. But: soft smooth baby-seal-like skin remains. 

Afterwards, we have lunch at one of the little Korean restaurants across the street, which we prefer to the in-house cafe. Nothing like some jjam-ppong to finish off the day!

The staff at the spa were all extremely nice and very sweet! I went into the spa on edc weekend and had a hard time finding a cab home. So One of the staff members were nice engough to voluntarily drive me and my friends back to our hotel in downtown Las Vegas. Which was very much appreciated. My massage therapist Ben was great btw.

If you are looking for a cost effective spa day, this is it.  While the facilities are a bit outdated, I literally feel like I am on vacation while I am there.  I like to bring my iPod with meditations as well as books and spend the day.  Highly recommend!

I've never been to a Korean Spa before, but after visiting this place, I'm certain that I will be going more often. I came here on a random Thursday morning, and it wasn't busy at all. They have a bunch of sauna rooms. Some of the saunas are designed so that you can take a 10 minute nap and not feel overwhelmed with the heat. I also like that this place has a "chill" room to cool off after coming out of a sauna or a steam room. 

I loved that they also served food there. I had their KRN beef ribs, and it tasted BOMB! Totally worth it. My friend and I stayed there for 6 hours, the longest we've ever stayed at a spa before. Granted, we did take a 2 hour nap in their nap room. My friend slept in the "yoga room" 

I paid $10 on a groupon deal that allows me the use their facilities all day long. Worth every penny, and THEN some. If you were to go to ceasers palace for their facilities it would cost $40 bucks for the day pass (still worth it though). If you're in Vegas and trying to recover from a hang-over, check this place out, it'll do wonders.

This is a beautiful Korean Spa centrally located with all the amenities.  Upstairs are dry saunas, meditation areas, a yoga room and a good restaurant.  This area is co-ed.  Downstairs the men and women have separate sections and there are herbal steam rooms, various kinds of whirlpools, showers, relaxation areas and grooming supplies.  This place is clean, well-organized and supervised. Lockers are secure and clothes, towels, sandals and other items are provided.  This place is a deal for $20 and a great deal with coupons or packages.  Body work, scrub showers and massage are extra but reasonably priced.

Best value in Vegas when it comes to spas.  It is a Korean Spa.... so, full nudity in gender designated locker rooms.  Most guys my age are OK with this but if you have a problem  getting in a hot tub , steam room or taking a shower naked I suggest you stay at home.  If you are not sure about something, ask someone.  Most are very friendly, but mind their own business.  You are there to relax, soooo...RELAX!  Staff is excellent, very friendly.  You have to do the red clay balls on the second floor.  Make sure you wear your clothes up there, it's coed.

My friend found this place through Groupon and she asked me to come with her. It was only $12 per person, so for my first spa experience, it was way more than worth it.

If you're worried about being nude, don't be :) it's a part of the culture and people are mostly there to relax. So it's not like gym intimidation where you think people are constantly comparing body types. You also get towels, so if you want, you can cover up between rooms. If you do go to the second floor, you have to put on whatever they give you at the lobby. 

Only thing - i didn't have slippers so I had to walk on the sides of my feet in some rooms 'cause the floors were just way too hot. My friend walked around in her own slippers, but I don't know if you're allowed to bring them or if that's something they can provide.

One week of abusing my body has landed me here. Drinking most nights has made me realize that alcohol is not my friend and I came here with a friend to detox. 

For $20 daytime or $30 nighttime, you get full access to the general facility. It is extra for services such as a scrub, massage, facial, wrap, or food. They have package deals that put the Strip to shame. 

Came in on a Thursday afternoon and had the whole bath area to myself. I showered, sat in the warm bath, switched to the cold bath, jumped in the herbal sauna, moved over to the dry salt steam room, scrubbed down with salt, lounged around the salt sauna with said salt still on me, watched it all melt away as I sweated out the toxins, washed off, shave, and the only person I had around me was the attendant. It was amazing. I could couldn't care less if people were around me, but if you are worried about it being crowded then a weekday afternoon might be best for you.

An hour and a half later, I was ready to go upstairs to meet my friend. We had lunch in the lunchroom. Prices are close to some restaurants outside. The ddeokpokki and udong are ok. The kimbap was my favorite. They were large filled with veggies, ham, and egg. 

In the communal area, there are recliners, tvs, a fitness room, clay ball room, jade clay room, salt room, and a cold room. Remember to stay hydrated throughout the day. Laying around the various rooms for four hours I must have guzzled a gallon of water and felt like a new man. 

The best part is that after all of that, I showered and repeated the bathing process again.

Best place to kill time and relax in Vegas! I didn't get any of the extra services but just hanging out at the spa alone and using the facilities was enough to lull me into an hour nap in one of their lounge rooms.  Be forewarned...full nudity is required to use the down stairs portion of the spa.  The sexes are segregated do it's not like you'll be at a xxx place at all.  I also ate lunch there and for the $12 I paid for the spicy beef soup and it was delicious and bountiful.  Great Korean food for a spa.  Next time I'm in town, I'll definitely be going back.

Okay, full disclosure, this was my first experience at a Korean spa so I don't really have anything to compare it to. All I can say is that I think I'd like to move in, or at least move to a town that has one of these available. I was a little nervous being a newbie and not entirely sure what to expect. Once I got over the initial weirdness of being in my birthday suit around strangers, which took about 2 seconds since everyone was so nonchalant about it, I just gave myself over to the experience of being relaxed and pampered beyond what I knew was possible. I spent about an hour bouncing between soaking pools of different temperatures and steam rooms with different properties (herb, salt, etc.) then had the 70 minute scrub and massage ($120). Again, a weird, but fully pleasurable and relaxing experience. Then I headed up to the co-ed section and enjoyed the red ball clay room. Everything was sparkling clean, professional, and I can't think of a single negative thing to say except that I should have stayed longer. And I could have if I wanted to. I bought a groupon for the use of the spa but found out it was included in the price of my treatments so I'll definitely go back and enjoy the tubs, steam rooms, and other amenities for about the cost of a movie ticket.

I enjoyed my time at this spa!  There are lockers for your belongings and toiletries for bathing after enjoying the various hot tubs and saunas.  I loved the herb sauna and ice room.  They had a room with heated clay balls about the size of a marble.  It was like a waterbed the way it contoured to your body but wonderfully heated!  There is a wide offering of facials, massages and treatments, but we didn't purchase any of them.  There is a drink and light food bar.  If you are looking for a place to just chill, soak, read or just hang out, this is it.

My girlfriend  really loved it!!! Next to riding ATV'S this was a major highlight of her trip!!! They took really good care of her and turned her day around considering she was a little pissy at me....thank gawd this place changed her entire mood!!!!! Thanks Imperial!!!!

Imperial Spa is the only authentic Korean Health Spa in Vegas. A massage, sauna, body scrub and Korean food is all available. This location used to be a 24 hour fitness is large. There are several sauna rooms like the salt block and clay ball room. The location is hard to find from Sahara since its tucked behind some commercial buildings.

Very rude staff, the chubby girl at the front desk and the other staff went out of their way to deny me entrance. They wanted to squeeze  more money out of me by saying my ticket wasn't  valid. I stood there mortified while other customers  were gawking at me as if I had done something wrong. The spa needs some serious upgrade. The pictures were very misleading, the building exterior was all rundown with broken car windows. Their amenities  were in horrilble shape, the shower stalls especially, the tubs were lukewarm.They need to offer slippers for their saunas cause it was burning hot to walk on. Overall experience  wasn't  worth what they were charging. I could of had a better experience  at home.

First I'll say that if you're afraid of nudity, stay home by yourself. The place is slightly out of the way from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The staff is courteous and checking in was a breeze. They give you a bracelet and send you to your respective male or female locker room. Upon entering the locker room, the first thing you do is remove your shoes and put them in a separate locker. I wish they were locked but they're not. I suggest going there with ratty shoes so no worries if they're taken. After storing your shoes, you proceed to your locker number and insert the key attached to your bracelet, strip off your clothes, shower and being to relax in the steam room, choice of a few saunas, cold plunge pool or lounge chairs.
The place was clean and one of the steam rooms had herbal infused steam.
Upstairs there's food, a cold room, hot clay room, jade room, etc. It's fun to check all of them out. I recommend bringing a pair of flip flops.
I recommend going with others. It's a great way to spend an afternoon.

This spa has so much to offer at a great price. Here are the deets on my experience...

A Groupon was available offering an all day spa pass for $15 which I could not pass up. This spot is off the beaten path so keep a watchful eye or you'll miss it. It's behind a few vacant business. When in doubt...make a left. Lol

Upon entering you're greeted at the desk where they provide you with towels, face cloths and tops with bottoms in your size. You're also issued a key for a locker to hold your personal belongings. They provide you with a quick run down of the facility and let you have at it. If you want a separate service, such as a massage, it's a separate price but they seemed to be reasonably priced.

The locker room and changing areas are your first stop through the entry doors. The lockers have ample space for your stuff. I would recommend bringing flip flops so you don't have to walk around barefoot. Leaving the locker room leads you into a large open mirrored area with sinks and outlets where you can blow dry your hair or primp before leaving the facility.  They provide lotion, shampoo/conditioner, hair gel...etc. The restrooms are on the same floor as well. 

Your spa journey starts after leaving the lounge naked. You're encouraged to shower before taking advantage of the spa offerings. There are 2 saunas--regular and herbal and 3 jacuzzi tubs--hot, warm and cold jacuzzi.  That herbal sauna though!!! OMGee! There is another shower area with clay filtered water shower heads. On the first level there is also a pink salt room for you to check out. 

The 2nd floor is coed so be sure to get your lounge wear on before heading up there. Lol The red clay room is up there along with several other interesting and relaxing rooms to chill in. There are quite a few leather chairs, a TV and a few massage chairs up there as well. If yoga is your thing, they have an ongoing class with a virtual instructor. 

While I didn't eat here, they do have a snack bar and what looked to be a healthy menu.

End result? It was fun walking around naked and the body and skin felt amazing.  This place is definitely worth a visit!

I got a groupon deal to spend some time with my girlfriends.  We were interested in the facilities and seeing what amenities they had to offer.

First impression, bright open entrance with hardly any smiles from the workers.  They offered us these super over-sized shirts and shorts that fits sumo sized.  They are very unattractive, but it did the cover up job.  I was handed a towel with this disgusting yellow stain that seemed like it could wash off, but it didn't look washed.  This didn't instill confidence within me about this facility.  

There was a quick explanation of the facilities and off we went.  No tour, just reading signs, using common sense and wandering about the entire facility.  It was pretty empty for being the weekend.  

Here's the entire facility breakdown:

There's 2 common lounge areas to watch TV, sleep or read on over-sized lazy boy type chairs.  

The clay room is like little igloos that you crawl into and lay in there.  It's just a hot sauna with red lighting and I can't tell if there's any benefits to lying there with the clay.  

The clay ball room is individual squared off spaces that is filled with what feels like marbles.  You have to really gently lay yourself onto it, because it's pretty painful getting out when trying to stand on marbles.  You just do a swim motion like you're at Chuck-e-Cheese and let the clay balls just warm you entire body.  Again, another hot sauna room.  Bare in mind, you can't last more than 10 minutes per room, per recommendations of the facility, because it's so deathly hot.

The chill room is literally just the chill room.  The U shape tile that allots about 7 women to sit in there comfortably and we switch from a hot treatment and back to the cool room each time to reset and cool down.  Nothing special, just a chilled room with mood lighting.  

The treatment rooms seem like they were all just in a big room, but separated by shoji screens.  The prices seemed reasonable, but if the facility wasn't attractive, I can't see how the treatments would have been any better.  

Then back downstairs is when the nakedness happens.  There's a sauna room, empty big room with floor mats to lie on and zen out.  The water features were a salt water pool, a cool plunge that wasn't working, a jacuzzi, 2 different steam rooms featuring herbal scents (by far my favorite), sit down showers, stand up showers that had the essentials and that was pretty much it.  I was not impressed with the water features.  The mixture of hot and muggy was a turn off and there was a smell the lingered.  We spent but most of our time showering off in there and back to the lockers.  

They had teeny tiny cups for water refills, but thank goodness the offered water.  There was the bare essentials like blow dryer, brush and maybe some cotton swabs.  I didn't find the place too pleasant, so the consensus was leave as soon as possible.  

There was a dining area and the food was over priced, but at least they offered food.  We didn't eat there, so I can't comment.

Next time, heading to the strip for a spa day is probably going to be the best bet.

Super Unique Korean Spa & restaurant in Vegas.  I used a Groupon for a day pass to the Spa facilities, which included an upstairs coed area and a downstairs women only locker area.
Plenty of places upstairs to just lounge, enjoy an electric massage chair $, follow along with an exercise Video in a spacious studio, cool off in the ice room, heat up in the red clay room, have a Korean meal, lay in the clay ball pit, and the relax in the jade crystal room. I felt transported to another place and time.  The locker rooms downstairs are adjacent to the steam, sauna, hot tubs, salt rooms and showers for all of your therapeutic needs.  Spa treatment rooms are nearby for classic Korean scrubs or just a basic facial treatment. 
I felt great after visiting the Spa, what a great place to recuperate, relax and it is very affordable!

This is a decent place to go for relaxation , full body scrub and massage is definitely worthed the price , spa is a good size with 2 steam rooms and 1 dry sauna a lot of showers ,jacuzzi tub and a cold tub , it's also a very clean everywhere. But there is one problem here Towels... they give you a towel when you check in and by the time you are trying to take your final shower and get out that towel is useless because that's the towel you use to wrap around you and sit in a steam rooms and dry sauna and at the end you definitely don't want to use that towel to dry yourself out after your final shower , they have a spot for clean small towels where you can get some but last two times I wasn't able to get any because there where none , when I asked the guy for more towels he said that they are washing them and need to wait 30 minutes , I mean common this is a spa you can't run out of towels... I would give this place a 5 stars if no towel issue , hopefully someone will see this review and will fix this issue. But in other hand if you want to visit this place get your own towel just in case

- very clean. didn't feel grossed out in the locker rooms, showers, spa rooms, etc. always saw a cleaning lady doing her thing.

- spa rooms were good quality. went into the green tea room, red clay ball room and the clay oven room. all felt amazing.

- all of the staff was friendly, approachable and on top of it.

Cons: there were some ants by the jacuzzi. (But didn't seem like it was an ignored issue - some things you just can't help). Food is overpriced. Been to many Korean spas that service high quality food for half the price. 

I love this place. Will return.
Awesome spot. Toe cracking good time. Off the strip which is good. 60 min $90. Well worth it. I'd suggest pay the extra $40 for the 90 minute. DO IT DO IT

I have been several times to this spa to use their facilities but never for a service. By far the best massage! If you are wanting the whole sensory experience with the glowing candles, scented aroma therapy, cozy linens on top of the massage tables and other things that lure you into spas then you will be disappointed. 

BUT, if you want a fabulous artisan massage by a strong Korean woman that will find that knot in your shoulder or back and make you limp like a wet noodle, THIS IS THE PLACE and ask for Emily. Apparently Korean Massage School is fine tuned compared to the message therapists I've received on the strip. No leaf is left unturned, from your scalp to your toes. 

If you are easily offended by exposing your naked butt, go else where. You are naked on your tummy, they cover your private area but she scoots down the cloth to work the sciatica on the butt cheeks. Boobs get massaged too, you are covered by a light gauze cloth.. 

I grew up in Japan until I was 18 and the Japanese Onsen is a way of living, nobody cares what you look like naked anyway. You have to go in with a mind set that these massages are not intended to be sleazy or inappropriate as seen by westerner. They are truly committed in providing excellent massage experience. So, if she moves your leg in a particular position and it exposes you a bit, don't have a "OMG, COW".  Nothing was intended inappropriately. 

The water area is swimsuit optional. Only saw 1 Caucasian woman wearing a bikini everyone else, NOT. They treat the locals right, with a discount of $5 off a massage and if you only want to use their facilities $18 for as long as y ou want to stay. The $18 is waived with a service purchase.

All the positive remarks about cleanliness on the reviews are all true!

Trying the massage and scrub next time, recommended by Emily.

Far exceeded my expectations for the price and a wonderful experience that I would easily recommend if you want to enjoy 5 hours for the locals price of $20 for a spa.  

There are 3 sauna rooms upstairs, including a movie theatre that are co-ed if you miss your significant other or opposite sex friend.  

The spicy ramen soup which included kimchi for $10 was a bargain.  

You may want to bring a book or magazine, unless you want to watch subtitled Korean soaps.  You don't need to bring anything because towel, clothes, and robe are provided

Had some major back pain after a weekend trip to Cali and decided to book a massage here.

The staff told me to arrive about ten minutes beforehand. I paid upon entry and was given the standard shorts/shirt to change into. My massage therapist was prompt and picked me up at the exact time for which I was scheduled. 

I stripped naked and she placed a sheet over me and worked on a full body massage over the sheet. Half way through she repeated the same massage with lotion and regular contact. The massage was great... Jenny made sure to check in and find out if the pressure was too hard. She seemed to really focus on my tight back spots and I felt better afterward.

Following my massage, I enjoyed the hot salt room adjoined to the ladies locker room, the women's jacuzzi, and even the wet salt room... Which was... Breathtaking. Literally, I don't think I stayed in there five minutes... Breathing was a little too challenging!

Afterward, I showered and surprisingly found the shower and supplied shampoo/conditioner to be quite good! I have thick hair and am always nervous about getting a good conditioner, but this one did the trick and got the knots out. 

I checked out the upstairs clay ball room but did not go in (next time). I was disappointed to find there wasn't anyone manning the restaurant upstairs as I might have indulged in a late night dinner...

The overall experience was good... $90 for a 60 min massage. I booked and was able to get in on the same day and two days later my back pain has substantially subsided. 

I was freaked out when I entered... Sketchy dude on his bike asked if he could come in and join me... But knowing this Vegas neighborhood isn't the greatest... I just think that's par for the course.

The spa was clean but not quiet and serene as others I have been to (MHotel, Venetian, and Green Valley Ranch). I could hear people outside during my massage and while in the hot salt room. And there were TVs playing odd channels in the lady's locker room... A bit distracting from an otherwise serene experience. 

Still, it was convenient and had the essentials so I would go back.

Love this spa. It's my second time here and I can't tell you enough that you must try. All the other reviews are spot on about this place. I haven't tried a massage yet but that is next on the to do list. My favorite room is the red clay balls. The jade room is amazing at really making you sweat out those toxins. Every time my skin has felt amazing after leaving here. So silky smooth.

I adore this spa!!!
I always leave super relaxed and the staff are very pleasant.
I have yet to purchase any services but the groupon offer is probably the best deal/ smartest thing the spa offers!
Complimentary razors and toothbrushes if you ask at the front desk.

Some basics:

First off, the lower floor, where the showers, locker rooms, and Jacuzzis are located, is an all-nude area. No biggie; everyone is of the same sex, everyone is minding their own business, and it's not awkward until you make it awkward. Don't make it awkward. 
Towels, shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel are provided. There are also cotton swabs and hair gel in the public bathroom area.

I highly recommend asking for slippers at the front desk or bringing your own, because the floors in the sauna rooms are HOT. Also make sure to stay hydrated. You're gonna be sweating after all. 

As for my experience:
This is the first Korean spa I have been to, but I have been to spas in Germany, so I do know what a good wellness experience looks like. 

I am a little confused that there are a lot of reviews about the friendly customer service and the helpful staff. Maybe they were on break when I walked in, because neither of the two ladies at the front desk were smiling or even talking to me. They silently took my phone to redeem my groupon deal and laid my spa outfit and locker key on the table for me and my friend. They then proceeded to look at us as if to say, "What are you still doing here? Be your way." It was only when I told them it was our first time here and whether there was anything specific rules or guidelines we should be looking out for, that one of the ladies finally gave us a very brief summary along the lines of, "Women on this side, men on this side, you can meet upstairs." Welp, alright then. Thanks. And yes, I have considered the fact that this behavior might have been because of a language barrier. And no, it is not. I have experienced perfect customer service abroad and in the US where people spoke a different language from their customers. I don't expect perfect English. Just friendly service. 

That said, the spa rooms upstairs aren't bad. My favorite is the clay ball room. You basically just lie down in a bed of marbles and immerse yourself in a pleasant heat for around ten minutes. If you have lain down on a sun-warmed rock before, you know how enjoyable that is. 
The ice room wasn't as cold as I expected, but it's a nice place to hang out at after sweating in one of the other rooms. There is also a food area. The platters are a bit on the expensive side, as to be expected at a spa. 

Overall, the Imperial Health Spa is a good deal with the Groupon (it's $24 for a two-person day pass), but it's not really anything to write home about. The service brought the experience down by quite a bit for me. Since I have not had any massages or treatments, I cannot speak for those.
Great fun. Not expensive. I may have thrown the first clay ball in the ball pit once the other patrons had gone.

I love Korean bathhouses and was thrilled to find this one in Vegas.  The price is a lot more reasonable then some of the fancy casinos and a great place to hang out with friends of both sexes as there is a common spa area.  The place was clean and lots of options in the gender specific wet rooms like standing shower area, sitting cleaning area, warm pool, hot pool, cold pool, sauna, herbal sauna.  This was just in the wet area.  Then getting comfy clothes to join our guys in the common area for relaxation in the various rooms like cold room, red clay balls, etc...  In other Korean spas, I could see Jade or amethyst or salt in the walls.  At this spa, all the surface were smooth so I assume the tiles were Jade or Salt...  The floor was hot so I wished I had brought some flip flops/slippers.  There was Korean food that I wish I had time to sample as that is my favorite cuisine.  Very relaxing place with friendly regulars that we could ask questions.  There wasn't a big presence of people working there so I had to get dressed and go to the front desk to ask any questions.  I opted for a thai massage but it was more like ashiatsu with massage bars that she held onto and walked on me.  Normally I love that style of massage but I was sore from hikes in Sedona and the cramped car ride to Vegas and she ended up hurting me.  She said I should have gotten deep tissue instead and she switched to that but I really didn't want oil and just wanted pressure and stretching.  My arm still hurts from her weight.  I hope it heals quickly.  I would definitely go back for the amenities and opt for a different massage therapist or not so sore and tight when I go back.

With the groupon, this place is the shit.  I loved the different pools.  I loved being naked.  I loved the clay rooms.  I loved all the saunas.  I wish I could have experienced more but I just had my lashes done and wasn't allowed to get them wet or sweat :(  I'd come back.  I was super relaxed!

After hearing about this place from all my friends and in need a spa day I decided to finally check it out. I've been to 3 other spas in town and this one is very different in the fact that everything is open including showering area and there are less hallways and secluded areas, especially for the male portion which may be how Korean spas are and I didn't have an issue with it. I did have an issue with everything being extremely HOT- the sauna was hot, the dry sauna benches were hot, the Jacuzzi was boiling,and  the infrared catacombs were baking me. It wasn't enjoyable to the say the least, but glad I at least got to finally check it out. 

The customer service was top notch and the ladies at the front were very friendly. The place is very clean and I felt like they used too much space for the dressing and lounging area and not enough for the actual spa amenities itself. The prices for massages are kinda high for being off the Strip and serving mainly locals. The sauna was incredibly small and uncomfortable due to high heat. They had two saunas on the male side but the other one was not working and the dry sauna was empty. The upstairs area has more fun having mostly clay type rooms to enjoy yourself. Like I said they were all HOT areas, but I tried each one out until my body was baked. It was a 2 hour experience for me and Ill stick to the Strip spas.

Lastly, the mens portion has this cruise-y vibe to it, as if all the guys are trying to get each other off. It was exhausting trying to avoid eye contact with them.I did manage to catch two guys in the act and like I said it's not the right place for anything of that nature considering everything is open space and huge windows are on EVERY room. If you're looking for a better spa to cruise for men or women go two blocks down to Hawks, Entourage or the Green Door.

How do people spend so much time here?!?!!?! I have plenty of experience with Korean spas and this place was very underwhelming. I was surprised at how few rooms there were and how LOUD the red ball room was. It's actually incredibly stressful and don't even think about eating! The food prices were out of control.

This place is so clean and friendly. Just located a few mins away from the strip and price isn't bad either. It's a bit smaller then I'm use to and feels cramped upstairs in the coed level. It has a small restaurant upstairs with three heated saunas and ice room. The salt room was in the girls level?  It's worth a visit but I do miss the ones in los Angeles.

I visited this spa a few weeks ago. Costs $20 to get in with an out of state ID, $15 for locals. Really nice place to go relax for a few hours. They serve food inside which was okay. I recommend this place if you're visiting Vegas.

The body scrub was rushed and took less than 20minutes.  The massage was then done right after, on the same scrub table, with towel laid down on damp surface.  The facial was great by Olga, nice, calm and soothing enviroment. For the package was $250. Do not recommend massage because of it being done in scrub room. The whirlpool and sauna area are nice but bathingsuit not an option. If you are not comfortable being naked than don't go.

4 out of 5 stars. 

My first Korean spa experience. I went based on yelp reviewed and family was going to get couples massage. Due to my work, I try to get 1-2 massages so why not ," when in Vegas"

The massage was standard $130 for 90 minutes deep tissue. It was a deep tissue experience I never had which is good thing. Felt like knots were taken out, body "popped" in right places and I felt amazing afterwards. Very professional. 

The reason for 4 and not 5 stars is you have to be "wow'd" in my opinion for 5. Service in beginning when I upgraded service from 60 to 90 minute massage was good, then before we left I asked if front desk could call us cab and she pointed to paper in front like it was inconvenience for her to call and told me I could call. The first number I called was a Korean gentleman which fine since I am half Korean but unfortunately I don't speak Korean. 

I will return for experience and massage though.

My boyfriend and I came here with a Living Social coupon ($20 for two). We have been wanting to try a Korean spa ever since seeing one featured on a late night talk show.

This place did not disappoint! I have been to many spas, and he has been to a few as well. When you get there, they give you a shirt, shorts, towel(s), and locker key. Then you go to your respective locker room. You may be barefoot or wear slippers throughout the facility - no street shoes.

We thoroughly enjoyed all of the co-ed sauna rooms upstairs. Our favorite was the room with the red clay balls. So warm and comfy! The pits closer to the back wall were warmer, and they also had a different type of stone. Very relaxing and romantic! The ice room afterwards was excellent - and not nearly as cold as I was expecting. It was a perfect way to cool down after being in the hot sauna.

Then he booked us a couples massage. They had full availability, so we didn't have to wait. The room was nice. It wasn't as fancy as an upscale spa, but definitely better than average. The price was reasonable as well. 

I can't remember the name of his massage therapist. He said it was a good massage but maybe not his favorite. I had a lovely therapist named Angela. She gave me one of the best massages I've ever had, plus she happened to do some energy work on me (Reiki). I've never had that done, but I've always wanted to try. I got lucky! I was in a ridiculously good mood afterwards, no doubt in part because of her good vibes. I will be seeing her again!!

After the massage, we returned to our respective areas. He tried out the wet areas, but I chickened out! Perhaps I will next time. You are not allowed to wear clothes in the water. I think clothing is optional downstairs (not co-ed), including the dry salt sauna. Clothing is required upstairs in the co-ed areas, of course.

Overall, this was a wonderful way to spend a few hours (even longer). We will be back!!

My favorite spot to chillax and unwind in Vegas! The only Korean spa in town, and they do a bang up job of keeping it awesome.

I've been here a few times in the past when I really need to get away. When the Groupon became available, I jumped at the opportunity. It may not look like much from the outside, but inside, it's high brow all the way.

After checkin, always make sure to give them your ID in order to get a pair of slippers to use around the gym. And shower before using the spa, hot tub, and before going upstairs to the communal area (and please dress in your given uniform before heading up!)

Upstairs in the communal area, there are a bunch of rooms heated to high temperatures to get you to sweat out the toxins. My favorite room is the one with the little balls that you can lie on! When it gets too hot, head on over to the ice room to cool off.

There are recliners and tv's where you can chill. In addition, there is a small cafe where you can buy food items. After sweating out a lot, I like to pass out on a recliner :D

Great fun, and you can stay from opening to closing if you want, but a few hours should be more then enough. Great to go with friends and family as well!!

My gf and I went to this location for a couple's massage during our staycation. I booked our appointment for 11AM. When we arrived at this location around 11AM, we were told to change into their clothing. We were given a locker key for men and women's locker room. The bathrooms and locker area is completely clean but prepare yourself for Asian/European nudity.  I mean, I wouldn't recommend sitting on the bench after changing into your clothes. 

We were taken to the third floor for our 90 minute massage appointment. I asked for firm massage and my gf went for gentle Swedish one. The massage was pretty good. They cover your entire body in 90 minutes and time flies like hell when you are this relaxed.  The only bad thing that I can report is that the male masseuse burped a lot, he literally burped in her face.  

After the burpy massage was over, we went to different sauna rooms. They are very relaxing and your massage package buys you whole days' worth of relaxation at this place.

I would recommend this location for have the best value per service. The service isn't bad, but it can be improved.

This place Rocks.. I've lived in Vegas for years & been to many of the spas.. This one is the best value for the $$.. It doesn't have the fluff of the strip spas.. It's simple, clean, and has everything you need.. The Accu massage is incredible.. They recently remodeled and now have a cold room upstairs in addition to the red clay & jade rooms.. These are coed.. The downstairs had 2 wet steam & a dry sauna.. There is a hot, warm & cold plunge.. I can stay here for hours..  Open 24 hrs & lots to do.. Enjoy!!

After being at full service spas in Cancun and DR, I was expecting Vegas to bring the same flair and level of "spa-ness". This establishment is not serene and welcoming. It's very "plain Jane". And while the staff was friendly, they were not helpful. As a first time patron, I was not shown around or explained the amenities. I am a plus size person (size 16/18) and they did not have shorts to fit, and the shirt was tight. I was given men's clothing to accommodate me. All spas I have been to had robes and slippers. There was no aromatherapy at the spa or during my massage. While my masseuse was attentive and had expertise, my overall experience with the spa itself was discouraging. I expected much more, especially for an establishment that services Vegas patrons.

Amazing! We bought an hour massage and got to use the facilities for free! They have several rooms that are therapeutic like the red clay ball room, red jade clay room and red clay room that works like an oven. It's Korean influenced, with separate hot tubs by gender! Highly recommend and will be back next time we're in Vegas.

While driving here the area may look sketchy but once I start you get inside imperial spa everything will be A-OK. 

Where else in Las Vegas can you enjoy a spa day alone or with your significant other for only $20? The 2nd floor is the unisex floor so clothes are mandatory and they also have food and a drink bar. 

The first floor has a men's side and ladies side. Everybody is pretty much naked. It reminds me of being in Japan. I love it.. 

Also, they provide you with clothes as well. You can't go wrong here. I come here at least 3 times a week. 

If you love have a spa day then this is a must for anybody in Las Vegas.

I came across this spa on Groupon and read a lot of great reviews on yelp so I decided to take a gamble.  First I want to thank everyone for your prior reviews, it really helped me know what to expect.  The experience was Fabulous.  This was my first time to a Korean Spa and will be back.  It was the highlight of my trip.  For the price the experience can't be beat.  I was there on a Wednesday afternoon and it didn't seem that busy.  Loved the clay ball room, make sure to take a towel with you and also ask for sandals (flip flops) many of the room have hot floors.

If I ever go back to Vegas, I'm definitely returning to the place.  Best part of my weekend in Vegas.  Staff is friendly, establishment is clean, and experience is so relaxing.  We spent about 3 hours here.  First two hours was split between the mens' wet areas (whirlpool, cold pool, sauna and steam) and the co-ed relax rooms (Clay ovens and marble beds).  Final hour was a body scrub and massage.  Never had the body scrub before...borderlines on pain as it feels like being scrubbed with sandpaper.  But left skin feeling great and the massage was the perfect way to finish it.  Best bargain in Vegas for $140 all in ($20 admission, $100 body scrub/massage, $20 tip).
I'm adding this to my monthly self care routine. We visited for the 1st time days ago & still can't stop talking about it!

This is not your ordinary spa. This is a Korean Bath house. If you are uncomfortable being naked around other people of the same sex, this may not be for you. They have separate male and female areas for the bathing, scrubbing,steaming, and sauna. There are also areas where males and females can enjoy hot rooms together in uniforms the "spa" provides.

If you have been to Spa Castle in Queens NYC this is like that on a smaller scale.

Great place to come and spend a few hours pampering yourself and your skin.  They have many massage services etc...but come for the steam and the baths and the scrub.

(read other reviews to get a better idea of the place overall- its really almost like traveling out of this country for a few hours).

I love this place sooooo relaxing so many great rooms to go and do a little nam Myoho renge kyo! Relax !!! Mmmm NAMASTE ! Jacuzzi galore and if you need a little scrub down by someone else no problem! Why not? But mmmmmmm you just have to be a little comfortable walking around with kitty showing :)

4 stars only because I couldn't enjoy the hot tub with my fiancé but other than that the spa was great. Love the red ball clay room, especially the ice room I'm a fan of cold weather. The message chair they have almost felt realistic and I can't forget to mention female and male dressing rooms are separate and yes they are butt naked so be mindful you will see things you don't wanna see. If kids are  attending they will see other people's private areas so be mindful of that also. They do serve meals upstairs on the second floor.

Nigel Angus
Executive Producer 
Palm Tree Flow Records LLC

My friend and I came here and we did not like the spa. We had couple's massage and it wasn't that great. The massage was super expensive ($180 for a couple's Swedish massage) for the quality of the place. We will definitely not be returning.

Ahhh, bliss. Pure bliss. That's what this place is. Was it a dream? I don't think so, but I'll start at the beginning, because this one's a doozy.

So, my best friend wanted to play 25 cent (you read that right) Roulette. We asked around and eventually, we were led to downtown Vegas at 3am to a place I like to call, "The Gates of Hell," also known as The El Cortez, ya know, either or. So here we are at El Cortez and...yeah. It was every Tarantino movie come to life. It was like the inside of the brain of every Elmore Leonard character. It was, in a word, dreadful. After about 15 minutes of repeated admonitions to my stupid friend not to "touch anything or anyone," we made our way through the smoke and found ourselves outside on a dark, dirty downtown street. My friend looked like he'd had 20 years shaved off his life. I took one look at him and said, "We need to save our souls." And this, my yelp friends, is how we came to find ourselves at Imperial Health Spa.

We got back to our hotel and I immediately started searching online in the hope that there was a Korean spa in Las Vegas because I knew, in my heart of hearts, that our spirits needed cleansing, and only a Korean spa (or a Holy water dunk tank) could do it.

 Lo! There it was. I tucked my friend into bed and we made our way there in the morning. I've been to several Korean spas in L.A. and in Washington state, so I know the deal, but if you don't, here it is: YOU'LL BE NAKED THE ENTIRE TIME. The only clothed areas are the check-in desk, co-ed infrared rooms, yoga room, and the lunch counter. Come to think of it, that's kind of a lot. But if you want the real deal fun, you'll be in the women only or men only section, enjoying your wet blessedness. You'll be in one of the hot pools or the steam room or the sauna. Do one or do them all, your choice. I like to make my way through the pools then cook myself in the steam, then stumble into the sauna, then back into the pools. But that's me, you do you. 

I joined my friend for a smoothie at the counter and he was having a ball in the guys' section. From what he told me, it's the same set up as the ladies' section (but you know we ladies have more fun). Anyway, we downed our fresh fruit smoothies (delicious, btw) and headed to the yoga room. We blissed out in there for a while to the soothing sounds of the on-a-loop yoga video, then went into all the infrared rooms, my favorite part. I was daydreaming in the little red, clay balls when I heard my friend snoring SO LOUDLY in the box next to me, he could have woken the dead. Since we were alone, I let him have at it. It was the sleep of ages. He was having a good time.

In the end, our souls were saved (yay!) and our bodies were cleansed of the debauchery and stupidity of youth. So, to sum up this novel, go here. You'll love it. Or you won't, but then I'm pretty sure that means there's something wrong with you. :)

Originally I thought this spa was going to be like an American spa. However, it was a Korean spa. So, ladies... get use to nudity.

So I came here two weeks ago and had the La Belle package. It was great! I had this therapist name Nitty. She was AWESOME!!! She did my body polish and massage. She was very knowledgeable and a therapist. The body scrubbing was intense, however after the procedure you are going to feel great in your skin. After the body wrap, I got my massage. Nitty was great. She did a great deep tissue massage. After the whole session, I felt relaxed and super refreshed. 

I definitely would come back again when I'm in Vegas!

The facilities seem somewhat small. I've been to spa castle in new york, and comparing it to that is somewhat unfair. 

on to the actual review... the counter girls are somewhat friendly if you come at the right time. They need to change the pamphlet because it is misleading saying that they have an ICE ROOM, but at which they do not.  The times that i have been there it wasn't busy at all which was sort of disappointing. The big plus they have for me is there theater room...they have a good selection of films to view, but i wonder if you can bring your own.  The food is one of the greater points of the spa. Cheap as far as Korean food does go, and worth every bit of it. 

at the very most i would return just to relieve some tension from what ever is stressing me. and i could recommend this spa because its cheap for the service they do provide.

The only Korean spa in Las Vegas. It's located on Sahara and Maryland in the same plaza as Rainbow's End grocery store. 

I must admit the facility is a bit outdated but it is still a real treat to go to detox and relax. And the owners do a great job maintaining this spa so it's very clean. First floor is where the locker rooms , showers , hot tubs , and saunas are all located. They provide towels as well as shampoo , conditioner and shower gel. Not the greatest quality products so bring your own if you're picky. Hairdryers and disposable razors & tooth brushes are also provided. They have three different saunas - steam sea salt , herbal , and dry salt room. My favorite would be the herbal one. I highly recommend bringing your own flip flops because some of the floors can get really hot. They used to provide flip flops for free but now you have to pay to rent a pair.

Also , keep in mind that the first floor is separated by sex and have to be all-nude to go in the hot tubs and saunas. If you aren't comfortable with that , I recommend going to Qua bath at Caesar's Palace or any of the other spas on the strip or resort casinos.

The second floor is co-ed so be sure to put on your lounge wear on before heading up there. They have a lounge area with resting chairs and TVs playing Korean cooking shows or news lol. There's also a cafe/restaurant that serves pretty good soondubu (spicy soft tofu soup). It comes with banchan (multiple side dishes like kimchi). The prices are steep though - typical spa prices. I normally just get their hard-boiled eggs (1$ each) and their Sikhye (sweet Korean rice cold drink).

All day pass is very affordable - Groupon deals range from ~12-15$ for one ! Definitely worth a visit. I always bring my cousins here whenever they visit in town. I have not had any of the massages or treatments they offer (since it costs $$$) so I cannot review on those.

I was going to this place for one thing alone, the body scrub. I had had them growing up and was in deperate need of one. What i did not realize was that I would get over an hour of pampering, massage, mask. etc.  The place is not plush, but is clean, efficient and has superb service. I will be back regularly.

I've been going to Imperial Spa for a while now and finally got a massage. Received the massage from Bruce who gave me the most wickedly great massage EVER! Professional and just the right amount of pressure. This place is less expensive than the spas on the strip regarding entrance fee ($20) or services. If you have a Groupon the entrance fee is ($12). The staff is courteous and helpful, there can be a language barrier depending on how educated and open to other cultures a customer is. If you go in there with an attitude, and put negative energy out into the universe, expect the same back. Just saying, so don't be dickish. I'm wanting to try a body scrub but I'm afraid. I hear from other patrons that it's a Korean style scrub and you will be scrubbed to the bone. My threshold for pain is low.

I could not give this place 5 stars because the downside of things are as follows. 
- maintenance is lacking. Missing ceiling panels in men's wet area and puddles of water during busy times. 
- lounge chairs need to be replaced. Sorry, I'm used to the finer things in life, and if the lounge chair screws are not working, how do you expect me to adjust it accordingly to my comfort level? It's not that expensive to replace...again, just saying.
- speaking of stuff to replace, the salt room floor mats REALLY needs replacing. They are tatted and very worn. And if that ever happens, can management lay down more than 3 mats?! There is a lot of floor space, and the mats are all in one corner. I'm comfortable naked, but I don't need to be that close to another naked man. 
- restaurant prices. Good lord the prices went up recently. It was already expensive to begin with, but now no matter how good the food is, it's a bit much. What used to be an $18 Kalbi Rib is now $25. The ice cream fruit cup (which is HUGE btw) was $9 is now $15. 
- the Jade hot room in the coed section, where is the jade? It is not the tiles on the walls because it is the same tiles on the floor.

Now for the good. 
- clean. The staff works hard at keeping the place clean. 
- the various rooms like the salt room, the red clay ball sauna, the hot hut room to sweat out whatever you want to eliminate through your pores. All rooms have different purposes regarding health and effects on the body. 
- the food at the restaurant is good. Most plates come with lots of side dishes.
