They have red clay balls where you literally sink your entire body and you swear off all the bad toxins in your body. They also have a jade room sauna where soaking off the jade in your body helps your metabolism and skin. To end off sweating in the saunas, you go in the cold room to close all your pores!

This place is so relaxing. You can stay here for as long as they stay open... all for $20! Amazing. Where else can you get a better deal?!

I love this place! Iv been coming here for years, it's like the coolest secret spot in vegas,  so a couple girlfriends & I decided to take a day to treat ourselves.  Started with yoga, a foot massage in China town and lastly a few hours at the spa,  you can check Groupon for great deals to get a couple of group of 4 in cheep,  I bought a $28 for 2 people to use.  The place is always clean,  they provide you with oversized shorts & t-shirts that give you a great laugh when u have it on & see yourself in them, kinda a pink smurf monk look, but when in the women's spa room you go butt naked  lol, tried wearing a bikini but they were not having it, so if ur shy this is defiantly a place to get over it,  honestly it's not even a big deal,  their is two jacuzzi's a freezing cold dipping pool to cool off and tighten ur skin, 2 steam rooms, massage rooms everywhere lounge rooms, yoga rooms, showers, jade rooms, clay ball room upstairs, massage chairs everywhere,  it's wonderful we spent 5 hours,  I bring my own scrubs and hair masks and facial masks and the girls & I share, it's so relaxing but also fun and you really get to sweat and detox.  My skin feels sooo wonderful and soft, I love this place!!

Great massage at a amazing price. We got a couple massage for $180 mine was deep tissue which normally they charge more. But after your massage they have jacuzzi steam room a small ball of clay room which is my favorite. I will most likes be going there again and again.  This is a must try if you're a tourist.  Staff doesn't speak English much. But customer service is outstanding despite language barrier.

I came here with a Groupon. Not really impressed with the staff. The spa wasn't as clean as I would have liked. It was my first time here & no one gave me any sense of direction were everythi by was located. In the ladies spa you have 2 dry sauna/ 1 herbal / 1 steam sauna. 3 pools. I just don't feel like it was a great experience will try a new place.

This place is a true hidden gem. I have never experienced a spa like this. The hot clay pellet beds are the best. Ice rooms, salt saunas and clay huts to meditate in. Absolutely recommend this place. I'm coming back.

I really really enjoy Imperial Health Spa. I give it four stars because the spa's rules are not enforced. It's a real treat when there are not too many people, as it seems many aren't too familiar with the rules. I have posted a picture with the three most important ones.
It's simple really. Let me walk you through it. 
Upon arrival you will be handed shirts, pants, a small and large towel, and waterproof keys. 
Women to the right and men to the left. 
First take off your shoes. They'll provide you with slippers if you ask. Place your street shoes in a locker. Any locker, as these do not require a key. 
Go to your locker and strip down to your birthday suit completely. Wrap a towel around yourself if you're conscious but at a jim jil bang it is common for everyone to be naked. No one cares how you look. Seriously.
Immediately after, GO SHOWER. Please please shower before entering any of the baths. Shower after the sauna. Shower after the restroom. Shower after a massage. Shower after and before every activity, preferably. There are standing and sit-down showers. Take your pick. 
When using the baths (jacuzzi) you have a choice between cold, warm, or hot water. In all three you are allowed to bring in NOTHING but your body. That means NO BATHING SUITS for sanitary purposes. These rules are also posted near the baths but it seems that customers fail to read signs. 
Do your best to remember that this is a spa - people come to relax, so please keep quiet. There are quiet rooms, but even if not in a quiet zone it would be polite use inside voices :-)
When you've had enough of saunas and jacuzzis and showers in between, put on the shirt and pants given to you in the beginning. Sure, they may not fit well. just fold up the pants at the hips a few times. Don't use your own. Again, for sanitary purposes. We don't know where your clothes have been. 
Once clothed go upstairs. Relax at the recliners/couches and watch television. Go into the clay ball room (bring the slippers- floors are HOT!), jade room, red clay room, ice room, or dark room temperature room. These are quiet rooms as well.
While you're up there do some yoga or watch a movie. Eat at their overpriced restaurant (it's a mere $20 for all-day use of their facilities, what do you expect!). $6 bowls of instant ramen but hey if you're hungry.. Then go back downstairs and shower again.
That's about all there is to it! Did I mention shower? Enjoy!

5/28/16 update: prices have risen at the restaurant. $8 for ramen?!  Be sure to ask for your razors or toothbrush at the front desk before going in now. Also, bring your own CLEAN flip flops for the saunas. 
Again, shower and enjoy!

I got a Groupon for 2 passes to use the spa. We were in Vegas for our Honeymoon and we went on our last day. We only had enough time to use the spa so no massage but dang this is a fancy shindig. What I like is that we were able to cruise together on the second floor, the other spa I went to was completely gender separated. The facility was clean and had room after room of really cool saunas, detox rooms, etc. I wish I had more time to use the facility but should I find myself in Vegas again they will find a returning customer.
Love coming here after a long day of work! So relaxing snd foods great as well. Very clean too

This is my first Korean spa experience, and I loved it. My favorites are the red clay ball room, the red clay dome room, and the ice room. This is a great experience if you just want to go somewhere away from the strip and relax. I will definitely visit again the next time I am in Vegas. Highly recommend.
i'm in love! wow omg this is my honey comb hideaway. Their are lots of places nearby to eat also. It's off the beaten path so it's my definition of in the CUTS :)

I know this place for many years. Before this was 24hr open.  Today is only till 11:30pm.
Great facility, very clean, a lot of options for many different spa room (steam, dry, salty, chilly, aroma, with rocks....).
You can came with friends and spend all day to enjoy relaxs time.

This a great Korean spa. Clean, cheap, huge facility including a cafe. Perfect place to spend the day sweating out your sins after a weekend of over-indulgence in the drink and food of Las Vegas. Tons of showers to start with, and all the product you need is provided (shampoo, conditioner and shower gel). Then move on to the dry sauna (disappointingly cold when I was there), Salt sauna, Steam Room, Herbal Steam Room, cold plunge and warm pool. Move to the co-ed area upstairs for Clay Ball Room, Green Jade Room, Red Clay Room - finish in the cold room to slow your her down again. The cafe with great cheap Korean food is there as well. I will definitely go back the next trip I take to Vegas!

Most of us regulars to Imperial Health Spa remembers the headache it was in the beginning first five months of last year, when they closed their doors temporarily for renovations, what started to only be a two month renovations turned into 5 months. 

Now when the doors finally reopened in May, I expected everything on the interior to be completely revamped, sad to say, from what I saw, everything looked the same, except for a couple MAJOR add-on's which I was very excited for. 

First, there is, in the Co-ed area up stairs, a fully functional family sitting, air conditioned area that still acts as a movie theater area. Just minus the big bulky wooden doors and kept it sealed and shut-in, and minus the 15 huge oversized, overused recliners, which I really miss. But at least the main area still has some recliners, although, i still prefer the ones they got rid of . haha. I usually just go in there to rest in silence and away from the rest of the guests, however if you feel like watching a movie, just ask one of the nice ladies at the food bar, and choose from the list which american, or korean movie you would like to watch and they will put it on for you! 

Secondly, AND MOST EXCITING, is the new addition of the ICE ROOM! oh yessss. No more running downstairs three times, changing in and out of sauna clothes just to take a dip in the ice cold bath. Now i can easily move from a sauna room and into a huge walk in FREEZER! awesome for bringing the heart rate down, but don't stay too long in there. 

That is pretty much it, I haven't been here in a while, but I hope that after my trip back from visiting family in Hawaii, i will maybe make a trip back here to wind back down from some jet lag, does anyone wanna join me? 

Happy Sweating! haha

I went there trying to save some money and it didn't work. I didn't save money and the spa is not nice. If you are thinking "nice" this is not the place. 
I purchased a package that included a scrub, deep tissue massage, and foot massage which I did not receive. I also added a facial that I upgraded to the collagen booster, which I thought was something more than a $1.00 packaged Korean mask and I got charged $30 more for.  I ended up spending $400 with tip.  There are many spas around town and even in the hotels that have packages for the same price, nicer, and cleaner.  
I wanted something to eat but when I went to check the cafe all the plates were about $18!!! 
I would not recommend this place.

I absolutely LOVE the Imperial Health Spa! It definitely is a hidden gem of Las Vegas. I used Groupon and went here with my cousin and best friend. Needless to say it was an amazing experience. I read a few of the reviews on Yelp just to see what I should expect. Let me tell you, some of these reviews were completely off. I came in expecting a beat up place but I was wrong. I suppose the previous reviewers were over-exaggerating. The women's locker room was spotless and the jacuzzis were clean as well. The Herbal Steam Room was amazing. But make sure to bring in a small towel to breathe through once you're in there! The steam room next to it wasn't working, though. So that was quite disappointing. However, even if it was available I would prefer the herbal room over the regular one. 

The second floor is co-ed. The uniforms that they provide are quite odd. I felt like a pink marshmallow in my outfit, but it was comfortable and clean. Make sure to try out every room on the second floor. The red clay room was my absolute favorite room. 

As for the food, the sweet lady who cooked my meal really does have a talent for cooking! The beef ribs were a bit pricey but insanely delicious. Try out the strawberry-banana smoothie as well. 

One more thing, if you wish to take a dip in the jacuzzis be warned that you have to go nude. They will tell you to get out and undress if you're wearing a swimsuit. I understand that not everyone is comfortable in their body (take myself for example) but no one will judge you or pay any attention to you if you take it all off. Just enjoy yourself and let it all hang out!

Okay, I was just there earlier...we stayed there about 3-4 hours.
I always go there when I need to sweat and relax.
This place always been good to relax and detox.
I thought I was getting cold and kind of feeling sick for couple of days..I went there and relaxed there for couple hours..when I came out..I feel great.
It's really clean  there and something you can afford, and it's worth it.
15 bucks and you can stay there long as you want..pretty nice :)

This place is very nice! I really miss the  experience since I've been back in America. This is great relaxing place without the extreme pricing of regular spas. 

I could not give it 5 stars because some of the showers were not working and I wish there was more monitoring of rules such as showering in between uses and no bathing suits. Some believe they are more clean by wearing a swim suit and that is false. Those are things I wish were more enforced like the spas in Korea. As well as photo taking in the dressing room. I noticed a few people nervous since others were taking selfies and didn't notice that others were in the background due to the mirrors. 



Again I love korean spas and I enjoyed imperial and will return. I just wish there was a little more management throughout whole facility.

My friend and I flew into Vegas late night and was in dire need of a shower and some relaxation before checking into our hotel room. That's when we found Imperial Health Spa.

I haven't really been to many Korean Spas but I felt really comfortable here. Upon entering the female section, there are lockers to place your shoes and belongings; the lockers were pretty big so I was able to fit my duffel bag and backpack in there. The spa gives you pajamas and two towels to use; they only give slippers to people receiving massages (or so I've heard). 

The shower area was kind of small, maybe only 6-7 heads however there were multiple stations where you could scrub yourself down. Shampoo, body wash and conditioner is located next to each shower head. BTW, this is a communal showering area, YOU HAVE TO BE NAKED TO ENTER.

Inside the bathing area, there were two jacuzzis, a small one and a larger one. There was also a steam room and sauna. Outside the bathing room, there's a red clay room where you can go relax as well. 

The second level is where the food facilities are as well as ALL the other sauna rooms. Being that i was in a hurry, I didn't get to check all the other different rooms. The food was ok, a bit overpriced.

All in all, if I ever needed a shower in a hurry or if I would just like to sweat out my toxins in multiple sauna rooms, I would come here. The facility is really clean and the workers are nice.

I have added this facility to my "What else to do in Vegas" list because this place is open until 11:30pm at night and opens at 8am.  If you ever arrive in Vegas drunk from the flight over first thing in the morning/redeye, Imperial Health Spa is the place to be to rejuvenate before you, well, get drunk in Vegas again!  Enjoy!

Enjoyed this spot a lot. Didn't hurt that I used a Groupon either. The only thing I don't like about Imperial is the price for services. $60 for a 30 min body scrub!? Sorry, standard everywhere is one hour, so I found that to be ridiculous.

Other than that, Imperial is pretty choice, despite it in being in the 'hood of Vegas. 

$20 to enter and use their facility. Bring your own flip flops if you can because they often run out. 
Please take off your shoes before you enter the locker room area! Change into your slippers or go barefoot, and YOU MUST TAKE A SHOWER BEFORE ENTERING THE FACILITIES. Come on people! It's plastered all over the walls. 

In the female only area: Whirlpools ( 1 hot, 1 warm, 1 cold soak), dry sauna, steam room and herbal steam room. GET NAKED. Don't be a weirdo and wear a bikini because really, nobody is there to check you out. And all of us ladies there have seen boobies and vaginas before so don't be shy. We really don't care about yours. No really, I don't care. 
They also provide toothbrushes, toothpaste and razors. So nice! In the locker room there is also gel, mousse, lotion, cotton swabs, tissue, hair dryers AND a curling iron. Very handy if you're going out and about afterward. There are a few reclining chairs to relax in and watch tv in the locker room, so feel free to bring a facial sheet mask to slap on when you're done. I saw quite a few ladies doing that.

Communal area had lots of rooms. Really enjoyed how spacious the communal area was. It has 2 sides of reclining chairs and tvs. 

Food option there was a bit pricier than all the other jjimjilbangs I've been to. I didn't bother to try any, but it smelled good. 

Fairly clean, and I did see a woman constantly cleaning. This spot used to be open 24 hours.. I wish it still was.

Going here was one of the best things I have ever done for myself!  The best massage I've had in my life.  (From Johnny)  It's beautiful, immaculately clean, great staff and an opportunity to try so many types of saunas and steam rooms for a very reasonable price.  Do not be intimidated if your new to the spa thing.  Definitely check out the upstairs.  A great place to go by yourself or with a group.  I've been 3 times in a month and still haven't tried everything.  The salt steam room will make your skin feel like a baby.  You want to try to go for at least 2 hours to get your moneys worth, but it's the best deal in town and a great way to start out the New Year:)

Rushed service, they close at 10:30, not 11:30 like they say they do. They made me walk barefoot in the slimy dirty facilities and even across the lobby because they had no spa shoes left. Even handjob parlors in China town give you spa shoes. Ridiculous. I ended up using my street shoes because I was so disgusted. The showers don't work, and they expect you to keep the same dirty wet towel your entire stay. They didn't give me a tour or tell me about anything, very unprofessional. I've had many deep tissues and have never felt so much pain. I asked again and again for lighter pressure and nothing, my masseuse barely spoke English. Overall I am more stressed from going then relaxed!

I love coming here for the simple fact that it's $20. It's definitely a unique type of spa place compared to most you see on the strip. They give you clothes to wear when walking around the common area, otherwise it's full nude only. 

The facilities are a bit run down, and the food is really expensive, but if you just wanna chill in a steam room for a bit, then a dry sauna, then do a jacuzzi and cold room, then it's decent. There's also this room I call the pizza ovens. You lay in them and it's quiet and comfy. The clay ball room is a little weird. I've almost died a few times slipping on those, but they feel pretty good. 

ProTip: don't go immediately when they open. It's takes a bit for hot rooms to get up to temp.

Very good spa place have different types of sauna, hot n cold,  have herb steam room too
 Its affordable for this kinda service they offer

Like a lot of first timers, I was a bit hesitant about being naked around women I didn't even know.  My sister felt a bit uneasy with it at first, but she agreed to get a massage while I did the go at your own pace stuff.

There is a separate entrance for men and women.  They give you two towels and a "gym outfit" which is basically the most unflattering thing ever.  It's a hospital scrub-like top and then these stretchy linen shorts.  Then you also get a key to a locker. 

The locker room/lounge was very nice.  They had comfy chairs and several women were there napping or just watching tv.  They had a lot of amenities, including disposable razors, individually wrapped toothbrushes, hair products, etc.  It felt like they had put a lot of thought into what to make available.  Right off the lounge is the entrance for the upstairs area for both men and women, which I will get to.  There was also a dry salt sauna.  When you enter the glass door there, you enter the main spa area.  Immediately upon entering, there is a dry suana ahead and showers to your right (you have to shower before going in anywhere and anytime after you get out of a sauna).  To the left there is a warm tub with jets, a hot tub, a cold water tub, a salt steam sauna and a eucalyptus sauna.  Pro tip: if you are new to one of the "wet" saunas, sit on the bottom step.  It will not be as hot since the steam rises.  Also, breathe through your mouth and not your nose and just stay in for a couple minutes.  There was also a section of little showers where you could sit on a stool close to the ground.

The upstairs area was nice, but I hated having to wear my gym outfit.  The rooms were hot and I didn't feel like adding polyester blend to the mix was relaxing.  Also, they have signs posted, but let me just tell you: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU STEP INTO THE CLAY BALL SECTION.  I don't know why, but I thought the signs meant "be careful when you step in the room" as opposed to "be careful when you step on the heaping pile of clay balls."  Yeah, I'm an idiot.  Anyway, I fell and woke up a very nice Asian man who asked me if I was ok.  I was, but I decided to beeline out of there and decided that the ice room would be the best option.  It's basically like a walk in freezer that you sit in, though it wasn't quite as cold as a freezer.  I got to talking with someone in the ice room and completely forgot that I had left my sister and her massage had ended 45 minutes earlier.  I was so worried that she would be mad at me, but when I looked for her, I found her completely naked, in the cold tub, talking gingerly with another woman.  I honestly don't know what it is about this place, but it was very freeing to be able to walk around with no clothes on and my sister ended up loving it, even though she was initially scared to be naked.  She said her massage was incredible, as well.

Honestly, this was the highlight of my trip to Vegas.  If you are thinking of coming here, please do.  It can be intimidating at first, but it was so, so nice and relaxing and freeing.  I've added this to my must do list when I come back in town.

This 2 star for the BAD MANNER CUSTOMER !!!! 

Stuff was very nice !!
It's enough few kind of hot tub , sauna , relaxing room ! I def will going back again !! 

But but guest quality was so disappointed 

If u don't wanna following store rules then don't come !! 

I saw few customer wearing swim suits in hot tub and stuff said swim clothes is not allowed in water .... 

I'm shocked young lady had so attitude talked back to stuff !! 

She said like " oh I've been here so many time but I never problem wit it ! " 

But stuff keep said its not allowed cloth on in water ...

She jus ignore and she didn't change nothing .... 

I felt so mad and I wanted say something to her ..... But I couldn't ,,, 

Other ladies maybe from Europe??
They 2 ladies wearing swim suite on .... 
I saw few times stuff said same things ..

They jus don't care ,,, keep doing face pack and what ever they want to do 

Omg why everybody don't have manner or respect ???? 

I think 2 ladies got something letter maybe about they can never come back to that place ,,,,, 

After they got letter 
Finally they said " I'm sorry .... I didn't mean like this .... Blah blah blah "

I like this place so I will go back 

I just really thought if no respect , can't follow store policy ... Then don't come !! 

This is Asian sauna !! No clothes no bikini in side water !

Hidden from the main street, you might think you'd get a happy ending at Imperial Health Spa. Well, you do -- but not that kind! (If that's what you want, you're better off collecting those hooker cards. I hear some of those chicks are running $35 specials!) 

I missed out on the Onsen experience in Japan, so I heard about Imperial Health Spa and decided to at least get something similar. It was worth it. Thanks Yelp!

Unfortunately traveling chica didn't want to come out here. Sharing bathwater and getting nekkid in Vegas just wasn't her thing! (Whether or not that's my thing will stay in Vegas!)

But hey -- I went in the morning around 8:30am and there were only a handful of people here, and most were in the co-ed area. The entire 1 1/2 hr I was there, I only saw 1 person in the nekkid area, aside from the staff who was walking back and forth carrying the laundry. 

Just like in Japan, they have the rows of wash stations lined up in a row, each station supplied with a hand-held shower and shampoo, conditioner, and bath gel dispensers. 

After your bath, you can choose to soak in the pools. There are 3 types: the cool one, the warm one, and the hot one, which is a jacuzzi. I didn't feel like the cool one, so I sat in the warm and hot ones. Ironically, the "hot" was only warm, so it was weird sitting in a warm jacuzzi. The "warm" (which was really the hottest) was nice and relaxing and there was a TV beside it so you could occupy your time while relaxing. I stayed in this one the longest. Aaahh....

There were also massage rooms and a dry and wet sauna in the females only area. 

I decided to go to the co-ed area since it was covered in my fee (they provide some pajamas to wear in that area). They have more hot rooms. One was simply a big room to sit in, another contained little cave-like areas for each person to rest in (kind of reminded me of a dog house, Lol), and the best ones (there were two like this) had boxes that contained rocks that you lay down on. Soooo relaxing! Two types of rocks -- smooth and rocky (har har). I preferred the smooth type. 

I wish there were Korean spas in the South. Or Japanese spas. Or just something similar. There is a place by my house that says Tokyo Health Spa, but alas, it was just a massage parlor. And it isn't even run by Japanese. Not such a happy ending for me Lol. 

But any day relaxing day spent at Imperial Health Spa is a happy ending, in my opinion. The spa is located far from the strip, so get a car and head north. It's worth it!

Everyone's nakie.
Little odd at first but this is vegas and all so i'm used to this sort of thing.
Didn't get a massage or anything but lounged around in the common area for a few hours.  I like those clay ball coffins.  The balls really get into your muscles and ease the tension on out.
The womens area was rad.
Hot tub is really hot!
Had a nice time w my gfs going btwn the wet saunas and the tubs.
Great way to spend a day unwinding.
I'll be back.   I hear good things about scrubs.

Wow. It looks like they either got new management or its all falling apart over here.

Lobby person took my money and didn't bother to tell me the hot water heaters weren't working. Don't get me wrong, a cold shower after the sauna heat can be quite lovely. 

Also discovered that only 1 steam room was working in the ladies' locker room, but they did put new shower heads in. Overall, the trip to Imperial spa was still good, the saunas were hot, the pools were delicious but whomever the attendant was at the front desk left much to be desired. His attitude and lack of interest  in my subpar experience is a shame. Pretty sure I won't be coming back.

I had read the other reviews on this place before I went, so I knew pretty much what to expect.  

First, there is no hanky-panky going on here.  This is not your typical "Happy Ending" massage spa.  You can pay for massage services, but they are totally professional and holistic.

There is not much "fluff" to Imperial Health Spa aside from the amazing spa/sauna rooms, but they are *very* much worth the entry price.  I cannot believe it's only $20 to access all of these amazing rooms, which is what keeps me coming back.  That's a price I can pay and not feel guilty about treating myself.  And if you go during a weekday, it's super quiet and peaceful.


Highly recommended.  Where I go to recharge!

My first jimjilbang experience! And my first massage!  Woohoo!!! 
. 
Went on Saturday 2-6-16 at 4:30PM and checked in at the front desk. I had booked a massage for myself and my husband and they asked if we would like to make it a couples massage for no extra charge.  How cool is that??  We got to be in the same room and candles were lit (oooh la la).  We paid $180 for two swedish massages for 60 minutes.  My technician was Angela and my husband's technician was T.K. I think.  The lights were dimmed and there was soft elevator-type music playing in the background.  I have nothing to compare this to since it was my first massage but I enjoyed it. 
.
 We were given shorts and a shirt to change into and then the technicians took us upstairs for the massage.  I think their clothing is asian sizing because they gave me a 4XL and it was sooooo tight.  I'm 5'2" and 230 pounds and those shorts were screamin....I was afraid to sit for fear I would rip them.  If you're a big gal like me you might want to bring your own clothing for the co-ed areas. Definitely bring your own flippy-floppies or you can rent a pair of theirs.  
. 
Any service over $80 comes with admission to the rest of the building so after our massage we explored the upstairs rooms.  My favorite was the red clay ball room which is basically just grown-up versions of ball pits like they used to have at mickey d's and burger king.  The balls are warm and they envelop every part of your body and it feels *amazing*.  We also tried the cold room which is like a walk-in cooler and the red clay room which is HOT and dry.  
. 
After that we went down into the spa area and I was super nervous about the nudity.  There are signs everywhere saying "no bathing suits allowed" but still there were three women in there wearing them so that made me even MORE nervous to get into my birthday suit.  Finally I just said screw it and stripped down.  Soon after those three ladies ripped off their bathing suits so I think I inspired them LOL 
. 
The downstairs had a bubbling hot tub, a FREAKIN HOT tub with no bubbles, a cold pool, sit-down jimjilbang showers, a steam room, stand up showers, a dry salt sauna, a regular dry sauna, and a salt steam sauna which was out of order.  The facilities are clean and well-maintained.  
. 
I really enjoyed the experience.  I was so apprehensive about being nude but once I got there it all faded away.  There is a groupon right now which makes it $15 I think for a day pass so definitely take advantage of that while you can.
Had the acupressure massage which was painfully amazing. Looks a bit institutional but has some great services and saunas. Prices are also affordable.

Great deal with Groupon for $13 per person:)if you are visiting Las Vegas I think that's something different to try and to relax. This place is very clean. Stuff is helpful. They have about 4 or 5 spa rooms ,jacuzzi,3 sauna rooms and pools . And the best there is massage chairs which is gonna cost you only $1 for 3 mins. If you get hungry or thirsty they also have a little food bar. Prices are above average. We  enjoyed it a lot. We will definitely come again.

I purchased a Groupon to check this place out and I'm so glad I did! Honestly the outside didn't look that great and the surrounding area is less than to be desired, however - the spa itself was very nice inside! It was clean, relaxing, and there were several rooms to enjoy your sauna. I went with my boyfriend and we were able to enjoy the co-ed area which was so awesome. There are several rooms to relax in and when we were done we ate at the Korean cafe which had really good food! It was a great time at the spa and we will for sure go back!

Went again this morning when they 1st opened. I had the place to myself for at least  1 hr. Then there was only a few people there.  Once again I had a very relaxing visit. This time a friend went with me and a few hrs after we were there she texted me and said who knew how nice and fun it could be being naked. She also said there was no one there but her for awhile, and even then there were only a few people. This time I took the opportunity to use the relaxation room in the men's locker room and took a nap! We used a coupon from amazon locals which cost us 9.50 each. We will go one more time as we are here for the week! Looking forward to that visit also.
It's like a Korean Bath House. Definitely not where you'd go if you were wanting something decent in the way of a spa. Definitely seedy and you might consider a tetanus shot before going.

I found this place on Groupon. What a treat but totally worth the full price! If you have half a day in Vegas - definitely treat yourself to this! Each room was my favorite. Give yourself time to do all of them - twice!

My wife and I had a horrible experience with the receptionist (Korean looking) lady who is very rude to us right from the beginning. We were waiting for our turn coz she was talking to the one righ before us and so we seated ourselves on their waiting chair.  When she was done with the first one, she rudely told us " you can't just sit there you have to pay".  She had not even started to ask us if we had an appointment or give simple pleasantries.  WTF, it took me a whole lot not to punch this idiot in the face if I wasn't thinking of the fact that I did not want to ruin my wife's day! She speaks perfect English and so I'm pretty sure communication was not a problem at the time.  The place was an upsell, the photos were taken from the best angles but I was still wondering what the hype was all about.  The only good thing about this place was the facial treatment that the Aesthetician  (Olga) gave us and that is about it.

Great way to blow off the steam from PMS, bloating and sore boobs included. It was my first time at a Korean bathhouse although I am pretty familiar with the concept from all the kdramas I watch. Me and my friend were brainstorming things to do to hangout and she suggested this place. The red clay balls are amazing for the cramps and sore muscles and the pools are great to relieve the back from the pain that comes with the swelling of the breasts.

I could barely make it for 3 minutes in the herbal steam room though, it was REALLY steamy and hard to breath. We stood in it for a couple minutes with our towels on our faces. Relax with facial masks and have a drink (they are REALLY SWEET). Bring something to read or a friend if you find the concept of relaxing as stressful as I do.

This is a great way to sweat out a hangover or deal with a really achy bad pms day. We were in here for a couple hours but it felt amazing and I'll probably do it again next month.

My friend and I went with some hesitation due to the wet areas being fully nude but got over it quick.  

The facility is very clean & modern.  The staff were attentive & informative. 

We ate at the eatery there.  The person doesn't know much English so just look at the pictures or order what you know for Korean food.  I ordered the spicy beef soup & my friend ordered the tofu soup.  They both were good & the sides were good too.

I got the 90 min. deep tissue & Swedish massage from Mark.  He was really good & worked on all my knots.  I stop getting deep tissue cause I bruise and of course, I'm bruised but he is really good.  Next time I'll just go with my hot stone massage.

We will definitely go back as the prices are reasonable & the facility is immaculate.

 FYI...the building is not visible from Sahara.  It's behind the office building.

Our last Vegas trip was very different from the traditional drinking and clubbing trip that we normally take. Instead of partying it up, the hubby and I just enjoyed a weekend of great food and relaxation.

We love going to k-spas back home, so we were thrilled to find one in Vegas as well. The spa is a nice size and has all of my favorite amenities including the clay ball/salt room. I love being able to lie down in the salt and over myself up with salt crystals to draw out my sweat and toxins. It leaves me feeling rejuvenated.

As with all great k-spas, this one also had a little restaurant that served chicken wings and shaved ice. The prices are a little steep considering the fact that the spa is a little outdated, but not a bad find!

Love it here. I come whenever I feel stressed or need some detox. This place always has a groupon available . Very reasonable price. I love all the different rooms and the fact that they have a yoga room with a video continuously playing. It's very low impact which I like. 

The steam rooms and red clay rooms are my favorite. I have not had any spa services here yet, but I intend to. I always feel much more relaxed and at ease when I leave this place.

As a spa facility day:
CHEAP as it gets and there are so many amenities you can hang out there for literally hours. Hot tubs, Hotter tubs, steam rooms, salt rooms, all the rooms upstairs, cold room, relaxation rooms. You can stay forever. You won't find a better price/minute value at any other spa. It is a little "ghetto fabulous" though. Don't expect the extra frills you would get at other spas and I make sure to wear my slippers EVERYWHERE, but for the price, it is fantastic

For spa treatments:
Price is a little higher than it should be for the services. The scrubs are crazy effective. You will literally have a new body at the end, but the technicians are less than debonair. Usually showing up in a bra and panties set (sometimes see-through) to pick you up for the service, do not expect modesty. Be prepared to expose all for every nook and cranny to get scrubbed down. There is a massage after the scrub but it is on the same uncomfortable flat bed with a plastic sheet on it that the scrub is done on. Again, no frills here, but it is an effective service.

This is my to go spot in LV to recharge an relax before/after many fun activities that LV asks from us. A great alternative for the Hotels' spa, I am glad that Vegas has this addition. In the co-ed section you have (Salt Brick Sauna Room,Red Clay Ball Sauna Room,Jade Sauna Room,Red Clay Room). It's clean and the prices are good. I also ate at the little Korean restaurant, the owner is very nice and beef soup is the perfect detox.

Amazing. It's just like the spas in Korea and even BETTER than what I remember because I hated going as a kid. 

I got the scrub and the wet oil massage. I didn't take my panties off because of the P factor... the incorrigible red sea virus.... the menstruation monster... the bloody- okay I'm done now.  I loved.. LOVED, the boob massage.  They should open up nonsexual massage rooms where they only focus on areas where the professionals lawfully avoid. Or is that what Thai massages are about?? Is there more than one way of getting a happy ending?

I was going to knock off a star for the food I didn't eat that I ordered from the cafe.  Their kimchi fried rice and kalbi needed salt... or ANYTHING. A rock would have tasted better.  But I'm reminded of the times when I look at my boyfriend and I think to myself, "I can do better!" But it really depends on the state of mind I was in when I had looked at him. So I won't knock off a star for the food. Maybe the food sucked in relation to the boob massage. Maybe the boob massage triggered the nerves that inhibited my taste buds.  Maybe I'm just generous.  Maybe I really did like the food and I forgot. 

The end.

Ever wondered why Korean women look so youthful??
Want to walk out feeling like a new born baby??

Then Keep calm, pamper yourself at Korean Spa!

Korean tradition used for thousands of years to exfoliate dead skin cells. In addition to polishing your skin, the process naturally flushes your lymphatic system as well, providing you with rejuvenation inside and out!  
Ever wondered why Korean women look so youthful, come discover real secret for yourself!

What you can do here: 

Chillax, Enjoy Saunas and Jimjil-bangs, Eat & Drink, Take a nap for hours,
Watch TV, Write your book, Yoga, 
Indulge yourself with Korean spa treatments... e.g. Body Scrub, Massage, Shampoo, Facial etc. Feel the Heaven... well I am VIP customer here :)

STAY AWAY FROM THIS SPA!!!Since owner changed it's become HORRIBLE SPA!!!!!! THE WORSE IVE EVER BEEN!!  Reception is horrible!! No English , do not polite!!
They shut down salt sauna... faucets is not working , just a couple of it working! sofa  is so old, nothing working ! Just horrible !!!!!!!!! 0 star!!!!!!!! 
So horrible!! Ppl please b smart and do not go there!!!!!! Brrrr NEVER AGAIN !! 
OWNER IS SOOOOOOOO HORRIBLE!!!

So I just had a horrible experience at the Imperial Spa. Never going back there again. I was a customer for 5 years, and recently I always bought a four person groupon pass. Today I wanted to go there and I noticed that the prices have gone way up but still decided to buy a two person pass, use one today and save one for next time. So the horrible old woman working in the front had the nerve to deny me access cuz my groupon was for two people and I was alone. So she argued with me she couldn't let me credit the groupon fir next visit and told me simply to call groupon and cancel my transaction. HORRIBLE customer service. Never going back again. VERY BAD ENERGY FROM HER!!!!!! I spoke to a lady that was walking out of the spa and she couldn't believe how nasty the woman behind the desk was and she said she's not returning either. Place smells like sewer!!!! I do t even want to leave one star but looks like I have to to be able to continue with the post. BOYCOT THIS DUMP!!!!!!!
dirty dirty dirty. everything is slimy inside of spa. masseuse barely speaks English. wonder if they are licensed massage therapist.

Still without a doubt the best and cleanest spa experience ever.  For those of you who can put away your western inhibitions and don't mind being in the buff around total strangers who you will probably never see again, this is a wonderful experience.  I did see a couple of patrons in bikinis this trip.  They have updated their facilities a bit and have added to their menu of services, but I still fall back to the original which includes a full body scrub (I do mean full body and I do mean SCRUB) followed by a relaxing massage, cucumber facial, and hair wash/condition.  $90.  This includes the use of the facilities.  

Upon arrival you will be issued a small towel, large towel, and short/shirt set which is required in the coed area upstairs.  Entering the locker room, you must first remove your shoes and place them in one of the lockers that don't lock.  Then proceed to the locker area for which you were given a locker key upon check-in.  

First shower then put on your short/shirt and go upstairs to experience the sauna rooms: jade, clay, clay ball.  I prefer the clay ball.  Know this: the floors in the sauna rooms are hot!  Also upstairs is a food service counter and lounge chairs where you can watch Korean TV.  Back downstairs in the ladies locker room is a dry salt sauna with mats on the floor - my favorite.  

Strip down and enter the wet area.  Another shower with wonderful coconut bath gel, shampoo, and conditioner followed by a sweat in either of the two saunas (salt or herbal), a quick rinse off shower and into the warm tub.  The cold tub is frigid and the hot tub is truly over the top hot.  They also have the traditional Korean bath house setup where you sit to bathe.  Try to spend about 30 minutes in the wet treatments before your therapist calls your number at which time you'll be escorted to the private treatment room.  Again, the scrub is a must and the massage, facial, and hair treatments are nice accompaniments.  Emily is a wonderful therapist.

They provide toothbrushes, toothpaste, hair gel, hairspray, dryers, and curling irons.

Hidden gem! Staff was very friendly, especially Marisol. The second floor heated saunas/quiet rooms were amazing & relaxing. Did I mention they have wifi? Just in case you wanna stream your favorite movie/show.

I'm a fan! Not your typical spa experience but if you're not shy about your body it's a good find. Imperial Health Spa is a Korean spa located off the strip - about a $20 cab ride. The facility has the standard amenities: steam/dry saunas, hot/warm/cold pools, showers, etc. There are separate floors for men and women, and a common floor for both to meet to relax and enjoy some coffee or food. 

This was my second visit and I got the La Belle package: scrub, massage, facial, and hair wash for $215, gratuity not included. The scrub is a little rough but that's kind of the point; by the time she was done my skin felt soft and new! The massage was relaxing, the facial refreshing, and the hair wash pretty standard. 

They have a variety of services and and you have full access to the facilities whole you wait for your treatment. It's a nice way to spend a few hours if you've got time to kill!

The best way to access this place is from Almond Tree lane.  We couldn't see it from Maryland, or Sahara, so getting there was a little challenging.  
I didn't know what to expect, but this place is very clean, and looks great on the inside.  
There is a lot of nudity in the women's section, but that doesn't really bother me.  Some people wear bikinis, some people don't bother.  I don't see the benefit of being fully nude, but I guess it's good to have options.
I was bummed that there was no salt in the dry salt sauna, or the wet salt sauna.  I was really looking forward to that.  Also, the wet herbal sauna didn't seem...herbal, and both wet saunas were insanely hot.  Wet saunas are kind of our thing, and it was a little irritating that they were both so hot that we were unable to use them.  The benches in there were hot enough to scald your butt. No wonder they were both empty. 
The upstairs area has lots of comfortable chairs, couches, and a tv with Korean programming. Unfortunately, the tv that people are watching in the lounge area can be heard in most of the relaxation rooms. Some soothing music probably would have been nicer.  
The relaxation rooms upstairs are really nice.  The red clay ball pits were amazing.  There was also a red clay room with little cave-like structures you could lay inside.  That room was probably the quietest.
There is a cafe, but we decided to skip it.  $10 for soup seems a little steep.  We were hoping for something smaller to snack on, but didn't really see anything.
After showering on our way out we realized that there were no hair dryers.  Not such a great surprise when it's cold out. 
 Oh well, we'll just have to bring our own next time.  Hopefully the salt, and sauna temperature issues will be worked out by then.

Overall, the experience was definitely worth it.  My mom, and I were both very relaxed when we were done.  We ended up spending 3 hours here, but would have stayed even longer if the wet saunas were usable.

Amaaaaaaazing!  Never been to a Korean Spa before, but we're coming back asap!  Great service, lovely people, beautiful facility, super duper relaxing.  Go go go!  I wish I lived in Vegas- might even start one in my home town!  So amazing.  Pricing was totally tolerable, even good compared to the exorbitant Vegas prices everywhere.

My mom has been trying to bring me here for a long time while always talking up a storm how great it is. Unlike my fellow Koreans, I'm not a big fan of the whole 'let's get naked and have a scrub down after sweating like a hog'. But there was a Groupon that was offered not too long ago - admission for 2 for $20. My mom says that a single admission is around $20. That being said, she immediately bought 6 Groupon vouchers.   

Imperial Spa made me a believer! I've been to "the best" Korean health spas but this place definitely takes the cake! Couple reasons why - this place isn't swarming with people (at least when I went on a weekday evening) and the hot rooms as well as the locker rooms are super duper squeaky clean. 

The building itself is hidden away around Sahara and Maryland. The physical address states Sahara Avenue but you won't find the building driving up or down it.  I had to drive into a small hidden street (or perhaps it was an entrance into a huge lot - I couldn't tell. It was dark!) in order to get to get there. Don't let the area fool you. When you walk in, you'll forget that you're in the backstreets of Sahara and Maryland!

Upon walking through the entrance doors, you'll find yourself in a large lobby area with a service desk in the middle. There's a greeter in the front. She was a cute older lady with a big smile on her face. In exchange for my Groupon voucher, she handed my mom and me 3 towels (small, medium and large), t-shirt and shorts as well our locker keys. Apparently you have to ask for slippers, or else they won't give them to you. There's also a basket full of razors and toothbrushes, complimentary of the spa. 

The entrance way to the locker rooms are located in the lobby. Walking into the locker room I found myself staring at a wall of tiny locker cubbies. Confused, I told my mom that my stuff didn't have a chance of fitting in those. My mom laughed and stated that those cubbies were for our shoes. Whoa! Separate lockers for our shoes. What a fantastic and thoughtful touch! Our actual lockers are located behind the shoe lockers and they were much bigger in size. 

The locker room is very big, very clean, and very awesome. There are four leather recliner chairs that you can rest in. Around the chairs are countertops with mirrors stocked with q-tips, lotion, hair mousse, hair dryers and hair brushes (these are in sanitizer). At the other end of the lockers is the Salt Room. This is a heated room with marble flooring in which you can lay down and sweat. This particular room is for women only so don't get too frightened when you see naked women walking around! The shower room is also located adjacent to the locker room. Shower room contains the steam and dry sauna, hot tubs and multiple showers equipped with shampoo, conditioner and shower gel. 

The second floor is the co-ed area. There's a large area with rows of black leather recliners. You can also find massage recliner chairs as well. Hungry much? The Imperial Spa Restaurant offers an array of Korean dishes as well as drinks. I think it's a little pricey compared to what you'd find at Korean restaurants around town. 

Around the large resting/restaurant area are additional heated rooms. There's a clay room - pits made for two people are filled with small clay balls. Lying in this really relieved a lot of tension in my back and shoulders. I thought this room was the hottest out of all of their rooms. There's also another room that contains what looks like clay ovens. One person can lay down within these clay domes and sweat it out. In addition, there's also the Jade Room where the floor and walls are all marble. The ceiling is coated with clay. There's an aroma that fills the air that really calmed me. I think this was my favorite out of all the heated rooms. 

I left Imperial Spa feeling rejuvenated. My skin was soft as a baby's bottom. I felt like I was glowing. Thanks, mom - you were right.
The massage was good but the staff at the front desk was not. They need to tell people what they offer when you call and when you check in.

WOW!! I have never been to a spa before, but this was so relaxing! I was in seventh heaven. I got a sports massage, then a foot massage. then I went to the clay room, where you get to lay down on some hot little balls of clay there are also sauna rooms dry and wet, plus whirlpools a gym room, and more a great experience overall. clean and professional. better than paying a fortune at the hotel spas.

Very unorganized. Make sure you call over and over to make sure your appt is scheduled. My friend and I had a disaster when scheduled for massages l. The only reason I'm giving them two stars is because the massage therapists were amazing but the rest was a nightmare! Rude, front desk! Didn't explain anything to us, just threw us the clothes and one towel and sent us in our way. Never again!

I was still trying to get over a cold and Jeff is a spa-whore, so i looked on Yelp for recommendations in Vegas.

I'm glad we stopped.  

The facility is quite clean.  There was a young man cleaning the wet areas the whole time we were there. 

Much like other Korean spas I've been to, I was greeted by a shoe locker area, before entering the locker room.  The clothes lockers have the weird little magnetic/electronic keys on plastic bands that looked like hair bands from the 80s.  
The men's locker room is huge.  On the left and right are lockers.  In the middle of the room  are 4 black leather  easy chairs and behind them, two red lounge type chairs.  A flat screen TV is across from these chairs.  (It was tuned to a basketball game.)

Along the walls are long counters with brushes and cotton swabs.  I'm used to seeing more grooming products than what they had out. (I only saw some lotion and nasty hair gel.)

Outside of the glass doors to the wet areas, there is a shelf with smaller and larger towels.  Immediately inside the glass doors is another shelf with towels, to your right.  To your left is a shelf with toothrushes, wash cloths, and razors.  The stand up showers are directly in front of you.  To the right of the shower areas is a flat screen TV.  (Tuned to a Korean talk show.)  There is a privacy screen by two of the showers to the right.  The remaining showers are open.  (It took me a while to figure out the showers.  You adjust temperature on the left dial.  There is no right dial and then you push the "button" in the middle for the water to turn on.   Think push button sink faucets, just you get to adjust the temperature on these.  I realize they have drought restrictions, so this was a clever idea, but strange to those of us who have never encountered that before.)  

To the left of the shower area is a huge hot tub with the jets going.  It is much deeper than you would initially expect, but a comfortable temperature and the jets are perfect for helping relax a tight bath.  

in the next room over, there are rows of sit-down (Asian-style showers).  They have glass dividers between them.  On a table near these showers is a large bucket of salt.  it is for the salt sauna.  

Across from the sit-down showers, there is a large cold pool.  It is deep, too, but not as cold as some places I've attended.  

Beyond the sit-down showers there is a body scrub area, sectioned off by a privacy screen.  To the left of the body scrub area there is the salt steam sauna, an herbal steam sauna and the dry sauna.   I didn't enter the dry sauna. 

After showering, I salted myself up and entered the salt sauna.  it was quite nice.  The heat and the steam made the salt melt and all my toxins left with it.  I ended up rinsing off and then moving to the herbal sauna.  This room was at a much higher temperature. It hurt to breathe in there, so I left it.  The salt did make my skin smoother.  

There is a room off to the side of the cold plunge.  I saw a young man go in there and he described his body scrub when he came out.  I think the term he used was "thorough."   That is my kind of body scrub!  

Going back out to the locker room, there is a resting room (in the dark) amidst one bank of lockers.  There  is a bathroom across from the stairs leading to the 2nd floor and the co-ed areas.  At the entrance of the stairs, there is a salt cave.  It is a large room with salt bricks along the walls and ceiling.  There are mats on the floor and head rests.  I stayed in there for about 10 minutes and was sweating by the end.  It didn't seem that hot, but it got me sweating.  I liked that room, quite a bit.  

When we entered, we were given "spa clothes"  Unfortunately, I wasn't able to go upstairs to the 2nd floor because my spa clothes were too  small for me.  Next time, I'll bring my own shorts and tshirt, so that I can go see what else this place has to offer.  

I didn't get a massage, though I doubt I would ever get one here, since I pay about half for the same kind of massage where I live.  I might pop for a body scrub, though.  :)

Went back twice and the steam, sauna were extremely hot and unbearable.  Don't forget to leave your ID there up front.  Sexual energy from other patrons can be a little overbearing but just ignore it and they will leave you alone.  Russians were screaming and speaking loud due to crisis back home.  I feel sorry at the cost of tranquility of my visit.

So was it plush, was it shiny and new? NO. Was is a great value? YES.  The woman at the front desk was friendly and helpful, the locker room was clean and easily accessible.  I especially liked the Red Clay Ball room.  I will be going back.

Get ready for that free roaming butt naked spa experience, my hubby was not ready. Definitely get the scrub...boy I must be 2 shade lighter!!! They scrub EVERY inch and rinse with warm tantalizing water. Not for the shy and I prefer to go at it alone to enjoy being au natural. Jenny is good and hubby liked it too! Go, enjoy and be freeeeeeee

Gave it a chance tonight with my fiance.
I paid general admission and used the basic amenities, bringing our own soaps, desired rags, conditioners, etc.

I will say I have only been to one other spa like this one and it was in Atlanta, GA called JeJu Wellness center.

I didnt expect for this one to come close to that one, 1. because we are in vegas and prices for such services are inflated.. , 2. because it looked alot smaller than what i have previously experienced.

the services are significantly more on services... starting $80-$90 & up and only had massage facial and wax services. also full beauty and body packages for both male and female i presume.


Anyways, the experience was alright. Since I have been to one like it before I already kind of know how it works. Im a fan of asian bathhouses. what i did not like however was the unprofessionalism on how the employees in the locker room areas don't attend to replenishing towels fast enough, especially since it was considerablly not even busy. Authentic korean bath houses usually over more services of a more wholistic nature.

the food was great felt like i was at my grandmas house real quick. service was chill food was good ordered the dumplings (potstickers) came with some delish ginger side garnish with jalepeno's

ginger tea and the carrot/apple juice.


As far as a get by regular wind down, becoming a general admission regular isn't far from reality in my opinion.


Although for my husband I will say his experience was great thanks to me being an awesome massage helper. but the lude behavior in the locker area at night before close was just disgusting. and honestly more things should be done about that. guys of both sexual orientations should feel comfortable coming to relax, especially if they are paying entry.
It should not be tolerated for men to do some of the disgusting things I heard from his traumatizing experience on that last-minute shower before check out..
I understand you can't control someone elses eyes, but masterbating right next to someone while they are trying to shower is just ridiculous and he even said they were roaming around doing it, the sauna, the hottub, and lounge area by hot tub and  I can see why guys don't accompany their wives to great experiences like this. its ridiculous and we can look past one person, but a whole shower area full of masterbating men? that made us very angry upon leaving..



none the less it didnt ruin the night, but in comparison to the one ive been to in atlanta, this one is alot less organized, smaller, alot less "sauna" room variations... and no locker security, or attendees. There should be something to regulate that. I want my husband to enjoy wellness too without getting an eyeful of MULTIPLE fellow clients pulling the rabbit out the hat..
--girl at front was not polite upon closing.
addressed "we're closed....get out!"

TIP BRING YOUR OWN SANDALS the floors are hot and when you go in the sauna with the balls enter with caution balls are slippery if you step in fast you can fall pretty bad...

STILL ON A MISSION FOR A 24 HR KOREAN BATH HOUSE LIKE THE ONE I HAD HOME IN ATLANTA!! now that i live here please imperial get it TOGETHER!!!

All of the hot tubs and sauna rooms were very clean and it was great being able to take your time At each room. The food at the lounge was very tasty and the chef was very nice. It took a bit long for the food to come out since it seemed that she was the only one in the kitchen and taking orders. 
I paid for the full body scrub and massage and was very disappointed. I understand that the scrub might not be something you would think of as relaxing experience but I did not expect to be laying in a cold room while the lady scrubbed me down. Their wasn't any music in the background and another thing is that when the scrub was over I thought I would be in a different room finishing off the massage part of it. I was wrong . She threw water on the bed where she had just gave me a scrub and she asked me to lay their for my massage . I was very cold and not relaxed at all. 


I was happy with how she did the scrub but it isn't set up very well. I feel that the price would not have been a problem of the end massage was a calm relaxing experience. But it wasn't.

I absolutely love this place. It was one of those random purchases I made on Groupons and dragged my mom along with me. Now it's one of my favorite places to go and relax. My favorite room is the red clay balls and also the salt room. I always feel exhausted when I leave but the next day I feel rejuvenated and my skin has never felt softer.  I'd recommend bringing tons of water or gatorade and also some snacks if you don't want to spend money in their cafe. Trust me you will get hungry!

I have been sick for a good whole month and after coming here, I instantly felt better. 

1) full nude(some people still wear swimwear)
2) always shower before you use anything. Seriously, don't be gross please. There are showers located everywhere for convenience purposes
3) bring slippers and bath/shower needs.
They have a lot of stuff but I recommend bringing your own because the quality of the stuff they provide isn't good. 
4) wear your normal clothes, you will change anyways
5) bring face mask, skin treatment, etc stuff if you want. 
6) upstairs=co ed, downstairs=gender separation. 
Upstairs=ice room, pilates, the kin/pizza oven room, red clay ball beds, bath salt beds, hot rock beds, clay/charcoal room, food court, massage chairs/sofa chairs and TV, restrooms
Downstairs=locker room, preparation/mirror room, steam room, heat room, hot jacuzzi, cold jacuzzi, warm jacuzzi, standing showers, sitting showers, salt room.

Well where do I start. 20 bucks for 10 hours to relax. I love this place. Rick the manager is great. I walked in there one day from a recommendation from a co-worker. I work in a hotel that has a spa and I still come here. It is a Korean Spa. Total difference experience. I spend about 3 hours here. It allows me to refocus and re-energize my brain. I highly recommend it. Its off the street a little. I passed it 3 times before I found it. Its a must see.

This place is very relaxing. There are showers, saunas, steam rooms, a yoga room, clay bead rooms where you can lay on top of warm clay beads, hot warm and cold tubs, and a quiet room where there's a bar and eating area and a nice Korean lady cooking up some delicious Korean food and tea, the Korean medicine tea and ginger tea is excellent! Nice quiet place if you are sore or tired and just need to relax, or sweat and detoxify. I bring all my toiletries and they provide lockers, they have toiletries there but I like to bring mine, and then a whole area you can blow dry your hair or do your facial ritual, and you'll walk out feeling like a new person. :D

This is definitly a great spa. If you go, check Groupon first to see if you can get in for $10. They have 2 floors. The top level, they give you some clothes to wear because it is co-ed and kids are also welcome. The first floor is seperated for each gender and while most people go nude, I am very conentional and wear my bathing suit. Its up to you, but dont skip this spa, if you think you have to wear your birthday suit, because you don't. You are allowed to wear a swim suit.
I take my daughter with me and we have a great time relaxing together. They also have sleepover rooms on Friday and Saturday, you can spend the night for $30, which is a lot cheaper than any hotel room in Vegas. 

Check them out!

I read the reviews on here with much excitement. I scheduled my appointment for May 11 weeks ago. I called to confirm last week. On Monday we had difficulty with traffic but just managed to get to the spa on time. When I walked in I was told "oh sorry, the masseuse decided to take the day off". No offers to reschedule or anything. And the "appology" wasn't sincere. The guy at the desk said he had called me but I didn't have a missed call on my cell. It really  put a damper on my vacation and I would never consider going there again.

I scheduled massages and scrubs a week before our arrival in Vegas. Usually hit touch of class for massages here - and will def. keep them as our usual here THEY give good massages.  On to this joint - 
When we arrived I was told that we did not Anwser the phone when they called the day befor to confirm. So our slots were given away. We never received a call. 
We were given appts 30 min later than originally set for. And apparently were squeezed in. Our treatments were less than half the time we payed for - we paid 150$ pp for 90 min. 
Most ppl would've just left without complaining. Not me. Total BS. We were issued a 60$ refund. 
Scrub was not impressive. We get scrubs at a Korean joint in NYC that is the bomb - so we have high standards. Massage was a JOKE. Good social experiment but won't be back.
Tried to visit today, but there is a  note posted on the front door announcing they are still closed for remodeling.  No indication of when they will be open again.

Very interesting place, clean , fun and very enjoyable.  Downstairs is the pools, steam rooms and sauna . That is single gender and must be naked.  Upstairs is co-ed with the different rooms  ( my favourite is the red clay ball ) the ovens are also very cool and easy to relax in .  Easy to spend whole day and inexpensive, they give you shorts and tee shirt but I wear my own and bring pool shoes.

Went there for my bachelorette party. Seemed nice and a good price to just relax but once we get there, we were told you can only go in the jacuzzi is you are completely NUDE. I'm not a prude but sitting in a hot tub with strangers naked is not my style. This wasn't mentioned anywhere so we were totally surprised. 

The sauna rooms where nice just wish we didn't have to wear such awkward clothing for most of them.

For the price of the services, I expended more.

I'm glad we have a nice big Korean spa here in Las Vegas like the ones they have in LA.. 

Here is a quick run down of how things go down at Imperial: 

-Check-in with the front desk.. She will give you your key, towels (3) and co-ed area clothes (shorts + shirt).. If you want slippers, you will need to leave your ID or keys up front with them. 
-Enter the locker room and put your shoes in the shoe locker with your number (you don't need your key for these). Go around the corner and find your locker with the same number and get naked! 
-Bring 1 towel with you and go into the spa area and start with a shower (always shower before you use any of the facilities).
-After your shower, feel free to use the hot tub, cold tub, dry sauna, herbal steam room, salt steam room..
-When you are ready to go upstairs, dry up and put on your co-ed clothes..
-Feel free to explore the different rooms and if you get hungry, order from the kitchen (everything gets charged to your locker number). 
-When you are done you will check out with the front desk. 

HOT TIP: The kitchen opens at 10AM. Imperial provides shampoo, conditioner, body wash, razors, tooth brushes, lotion, hair spray and more...

WoW! I really loved this place! This was my first Korean spa experience and I really enjoyed my time spent. On the bottom floor, the men and women are separate and you gotta pretty much be naked while using their tubs, saunas, and showers. The second floor is the co-ed area where there are 3? 4? different sauna rooms you can use. I really enjoyed the clay ball room and the red clay room. Those were my favorites. This is a must-stop-spot when going to Vegas!

First time and it was really nice. The staff were so kind and helpful. Loved all the different sauna rooms my favorite was the red clay ball pits, that was even better than the hot mud bath I did in Palm Springs and a lot cleaner.  The herbal steam sauna was great and very hot. The only advice is take a pair of clean flip flops to wear or buy a pair at the front desk, some of the floors in the rooms are to hot to walk on. Well worth the drive and it was only 20.00.

Wow imperial spa is heaven not too far from strip. BUT a world or two away. Total relaxation with hot spas. Saunas..yoga class.  My favorite was the red clay sauna. I loved lying in a bed of small red clay balls inside sauna. They say it's great from detoxing and stress release. I feel totally relaxed and have a weight off my shoulders. Just wished I had found this earlier. Kept seeing the Groupon but ignored it as I thought it was in the imperial palace...staff is lovely. 
We were greeted by a lovely woman who gave us a warm welcome. Next time I will bring extra Towels and bottle water. Oh and there's a cool quiet and dark  room which I enjoyed as well. I don't get much peace and quiet. Got it at imperial spa

Any Asian owned business that has the word "Spa" in its name will raise suspicions of being a "rub and tug."  Being a member of law enforcement,  I have to be extra vigilant about the businesses I patronize.  Imperial Health Spa was recommended to me by several female friends and after some research on Yelp, I felt it was an legitimate spa and made an appointment.

The spa layout is pretty simple unless you're gender-confused.  It is located in a two story building and divided into three areas; the top floor is the co-ed area and the bottom is segregated by gender. 

Before I go any further, I must warn you...  DO NOT go if you are not comfortable with same-sex full frontal nudity.  There will be naked people there and they will walk as if they are strolling in the park.  If you have a hang up about being naked, don't go, because if I catch you checking out my junk, I'm gonna kick your butt--and two naked dudes fighting in a spa is the last thing ANYONE wants to see.

When you arrive, you will be checked in by the receptionist, it costs $15 for locals and $20 for non-locals to use the facilities (Mani, Pedi, Facial, Massages, Exfols services are also available at extra cost).  You will be given a set of shorts,  hospital scrubs, 2 towels and a key.  The key is for your locker, the rest, hopefully, are self explanatory.

When you walk into the changing area, there will be mini-lockers, those mini-lockers are for your shoes.  You are now faced with a couple of decisions, put your shoes in the mini shoe locker or your key locker; and use the slippers in the mini shoe locker or go bare foot.  You're an adult, figure it out.

There will be lockers and the number on your key will correspond to the locker.  Get out of your street clothes,  wrap a towel around yourself, hit the showers.  In the segregated area, there will be:

Stand-up Showers
Sit-down Asian Showers
Hot Tub
Cool Tub
Salt Steam Room
Herbal Steam Room
Dry Sauna
Salt Hot Sauna

PLEASE SHOWER AFTER YOU VISIT EACH AREA... shower/hot tub/shower/steam room/shower/cave/shower/sauna... and any combination thereof, just shower after each "area."

The upstairs is the co-ed area, it consists of a general lounge area with big comfy lazy-boy chairs where you can watch TV and a mini-restaurant that serves basic Korean/Asian food as well as some boba/smoothie drinks.  Upstairs specialty rooms are as follows:

Salt Brick Room - A hot room with salt bricks
Red Clay Ball Sauna - Think kitty litter, for humans, without the poo.
Jade Sauna - Not sure what this room was for and didn't bother to read the sign, just remember it being hot
Red Clay Room- It's a red clay igloo... also hot.
Cold Room - Basically a walk in freezer
Mini Gym - I don't exercise, so I avoided this room.  I think there were treadmills and stationary bikes.

I got the combo package of "Pure Heaven" which consisted of a Body Scrub, Swedish Massage and Fresh Grated Cucumber Mask (70 minutes, $130).  The scrub was great, left my skin baby soft.  The cucumber mask made me hungry.  The massage was okay.  

I took one star away for the fact that I didn't have a choice of getting a female therapist... becuase I got the body scrub, the entire package had to be done by a middle-age Korean man.  I was told that if I wanted a female therapist, I should have separated out the massage and body rub; wherein the exfoliation would be done by a man and the massage portion, a woman.  Fine, next time I know.

I did enjoy the Tofu soup at the restaurant ($9.00)... which was prepared by a woman.

All in all, it's a pretty good experience, relaxing after having to deal with my crazy mother.
Just had maybe the best massage of my life. Ben did an awesome awesome job. I recommend him highly!! Imperial Spa is a hidden gem in Las Vegas and an amazing health day spa.

Best Korean Spa I've been too and I've been to 3 in the the Bay Area, 1 in San Diego. This place is huge with pretty good food. I had a nice tofu pot. In addition to my excellent scrub and massage, they have a huge red clay room, salt room and jade room where being in a warm room with minerals detoxifies your body.  Excellent experience and will definitely come back!

I love this place. It is a relaxing space to relieve stress and tense muscles. I feel so much lighter whenever I leave !!

I definitely recommend trying it out and make sure to buy the groupon that's available!!!

You will never want to go to a traditional spa after this again, although a bit pricey compared to other traditional korean spas, this place is quite nice and the korean body scrub/massage is definitely better than any regular Swedish massage. You will feel like a new person! Each of the spa rooms are amazing. My favorite is the salt room, taking a short nap you will feel totally energized! Please call ahead since this last time I went their hot tubs were out of order, but they did give me a $5 discount for the inconvenience.

Used to frequent this place about once a month (spa day + 90 minute massage) until the hostile (and stingy) new management took over. Clearly they are in severe financial trouble based on the cuts in maintenance, cleanliness and staffing. You often are trapped there when it is time to leave after showering off due to no towels available. Also, they recently turned the peaceful salt sauna into a prison yard with bright lights (like a stadium) and make you change in and out of the ratty old uniforms they give you. Additional, the cold plunge pool is often at room temperature and the second sauna is off. Hardly a place to relax. I had recommended this place to several friends who visit Vegas as a no-frills "Korean" style spa at a reasonable price. Now I feel bad and will tell them to stay away and let all of their friends know as well.
I've been here several times. Excellent for people who want to unwind and relax in silence. Love this place, thank you to the staff!

It's a pretty standard K-spa. Which is to say, you go in, you get naked, you splash around in the tubs and sweat in the steam and sauna and shower and repeat until you're super mellow and clean.

Three stars because it's honestly not on par with the ones in LA and in SF. It's bigger but dirtier than the one in SD.

If you're in Vegas I'd recommend just doing the spa at the Luxor, it's the same type of deal but way more modern and cleaner. This is definitely a no-frills K-spa experience for a city all about hedonism and pampering.

First time visit today! It was so relaxing! Very clean and organized. The woman's only area had a great selection of heated and not heated tubs with multiple steam rooms and saunas. The coed area had an even larger selection. I loved bouncing between the clay room and the Ice room.... Yes the uniforms are odd but it's normal for a Korean spa..... Oh and if your expecting a "relaxing time" if you are getting a scrub treatment it doesn't really work like that.... It Korean and traditional it's going to be rough.... I will be going again!!

Imperial Health Spa is Korean spas at its best. It's spacious, new and super clean. There are tons of rooms to choose from for detoxification (i.e clay rooms, Jewel room, mud hut room, etc.), three different jacuzzis with varying levels of heat, two steam rooms (salt and herbal) and plenty of shower space. For $20, you can relax all day in the facility. They also offer body scrubs, massages, and facials. You can even order Korean food here. This is a great place to spend some quality time with your girlfriends or your sweetheart.

I have found my Vegas retreat! What an amazing place to go and unwind. Very relaxing and the amenities offered is more than anyone can ask for. The price is right and its spotless! My personal favorites are the herbal steam room, the red clay ball room, the arctic room and the salt hot sauna. The walls are covered with breathtaking art pieces and there are lounge chairs all over to nap in between rooms. FYI this is a nude spa! The downstairs is segregated by sex and you will see many women or men walking around nude. Its not something to be intimidated of, its actually kind of liberating. Upstairs is coed... that's where most of the rooms are, as well as many lounge chairs to relax. Also, there is a mini restaurant upstairs. They will provide you with unflattering shorts and a shirt to use upstairs. I must say the only downfall is the location, its in the ghetto BUT keep in mind a location this size anywhere else would cost an arm and a leg and spike the entrance cost! Therefore I will not knock off a star for that. Enjoy this place, Its well worth it!

I just came here for a facial and I had Marina! I have tried many different facials around town and I loved this! She gave a very through massage and also educated about what kind of treatment should be used based on my skin! She was amazing and I def recommend asking for her if you get a facial here!

love love love my experience here!!!  I am a amassage therapist and am always trying to find good places to relax.  It was my first experience at a Korean Spa... I'll leave the experience a suprise for you :)

Joandra & NItty were amazing!!  That is it...

I am a HUGE fan of this place! I cant believe I waited so long to go back. 

If you want a high-price spa facility experience for $20, check this place out. They don't have the fancy robes or staff to kiss your butt like they do at the on-strip properties. But, they do have all of the same awesome amenities (and more) than the on-strip properties minus all the snobby people that go on-strip. It is very casual here and I like that. 

My most recent trip: I got a back facial. It was very relaxing and well worth the $110. That also included the price of admission. I used the hot tub, showers, steam rooms, dry sauna room and I spent a decent amount of time in the clay ball room. 

Food: Wonton soup was AWESOME! I also had some Ginger tea that I have been craving since I left.

BEWARE of GIFT CERTIFICATES -Received a gift certificate for the Fullerton spa and was told that is was good at both locations, it even says it on the gift certificate.  So when I tried to use it in Vegas they said they would not allow me to use it.  I asked for an explanation and the women just kept saying "No no good here".  It was weird how she suddenly started to speak broken English and could only repeat the same thing over and over.  What a scam.  Extremely disappointing.

By far the best swedish massage I've ever had.
