My first time there yesterday and my last , therapist Nancy  barley spoke English and was rude but made sure to give me an envelope to tip her. no attendants in sight to ask questions to. $160 Down the drain.

It's official.  I'm addicted to Korean spas.

My boyfriend schemed with my girl friend to take me here to celebrate some turning points in our lives (grad school acceptance, etc.).  At this point, I had only visted the Wi Spa in LA.  

Imperial Spa is HUGE.  It's a little bit hard to find, tucked in the back behind some buildings.  It boasts its own parking lot with plenty of space.

When you enter the lobby, you will check in and pay your entrance fee at the desk.  Feel free to inquire about any services you may want, although it is prudent to book these services in advance.  You will be given a numbered electronic key wristband.  Put it on right away to save you from the mistake of accidentally leaving it in your automatically locking locker.  You will also be given shorts, a t-shirt, a small towel, and a big towel.  From there, men and women will enter separate spas through the designated door.

When you enter the women's side, you first encounter small lockers for your shoes.  Remove your street shoes and place them in your assigned locker (these are not lockable).  Beyond that point is a "no street shoe policy."

You will then come up to a set of larger lockers in which to store your things.  Open the locker by pressing your wristband key up to the reader.  Store your belongings and strip down to your birthday suit.  Feel free to wrap your big towel around you to start to get used to walking around nekkid.  It's also nice to have the towel to set down on benches in the dry sauna/steam room.

PRO TIP:  Bring an extra towel for post-spa showering/drying off.

From here, take a thorough shower and get squeaky clean.  Your fellow spa patrons will appreciate it.  Then you're free to use all the amenities!  Just remember to rinse off after using the steam/sauna rooms.  A good rule to remember is:  If you sweat, shower.

If you're with a co-ed party, put on your provided shorts/t-shirt and meet up in the jiljimbang (co-ed area) to explore the sauna rooms, relax, and eat!

Korean spas are WONDERFUL, inexpensive (comparatively), and social.  Even at full price admission ($25/person), it is money well spent for a day of relaxation.

PRO TIP:  This is also a SUPERB way to start girls night out.  They have incredible vanity stations where you can do your hair/make-up, also lots of blow dryers.

PRO TIP:  Bring your usual shower gear (face-wash, loofah, etc.) to take a proper shower after your spa day.

Bobby b's review is very detailed and covered lots of information

I decided to go there for a groupon special, $10 per person for spa admission instead of their regular $20, but since I purchased the aromatic massage and body scrub the admission fee was waived 

My skin feels sooooooo smooth and new born after the scrubbing and massaging ,,, me happy :)

I will definitely be back

The only reason I am giving it a four star is that the steam rooms were way too hot and there were no icy towels outside them for people's convenience or to avoid people getting a 3rd steam burn ,,, and for the life of me I couldn't find the room with all the wooden tubs as shown in the pictures

But all in all,,, I like this place and will be back whenever I am in town in Vegas

another complaint I have against this place is at the front counter they posted a sign "any purchase with $90 or more receives a free bathrobe".... we purchased two aromatherapy massage and body scrubs, total $240, so when i asked them about the bathrobes (not that our family really need them but since it's offered why not?" and we were told it has to be "gift card purchase of $90 or more"....to me, it didn't make sense... I guess i should have purchased two separate gift cards then spent them on the spa services lol

anyways.... next time when i am in town I will totally come back and enjoy a relaxing day =)

Body scrub by Dana is out of this world. For those of you who are not familiar with a Korean body scrub have not lived life completely. Your skin looks and feels like a baby's. The facilities are clean and easy to use. Next time Ill make a full day of it and take a nap there too. Im hooked.

I'm giving a 2 star not because the place isn't nice ( which it is ) the reason for my rating is that the place didn't disclose that this establishment is a full NUDITY property . If you are ok with that , then you will enjoy it but in my case I went with my 12 years old daughter ( which I called in advance and was  told it was ok to bring her and never disclose the fact that females will be naked )  .
We couldn't enjoy any of the amenities as you need to be naked for everything ( pool , sauna , clay room , etc )
My Daughter was trying to get in the sauna when ( a fully dressed employee ) told her in a broken English that she couldn't were a swimsuit and needed to get naked .Obviously that was not going to happen ...  
Basically we went in an out within minutes as we couldn't even shower as my daughter was really uncomfortable . We went to spas before and it was a blast, little we know about the nudity issue which again was never mention at their webpage or inside the spa .
I'm writing this review to give you guys a head up , so know you know .

Absolutely horrible. Very uncomfortable vibe in the locker/mens area rooms.  Massage was no better than something for 1/3 of the price in Chinatown.  Things seemed clean, but the whole place was all-around weird. After spending strip spa prices, we got a 3rd rate experience.

Your 1 stop shop for relaxation.  Been here twice now, first time I didn't really know what to expect but I went with girlfriends who told me what to do/where to go.  We spent most of our time in the co-Ed areas (the heated clay rooms/ice rooms).  The next time I went I met up with friends again but stayed several hours later by myself to enjoy the female only areas on the 1st floor.  The first floor (naked floor) included the showers, tubs and steam rooms.  There were several different tubs, a cold tub, warm tub and hot tub.  It was nice going into a steam room and then going into one of the cold tubs afterwards.  I never thought I'd be able to spend so much time at a spa but I was probably there for a good 3-4 hours alone.  If you are there with a male/female group or going as a couple you can only spend time on the 2nd floor which is the co-Ed floor and you must wear your spa attire (t shirt and shorts provided at the front desk). The cool thing about the 2nd floor is the food/drinks you can order and the section where they have TVs and recliners.  I went on a Sunday so some people were watching the football games.  *wear your provides flip flops or wear your own especially in the hot rooms, your feet will burn up!
Best massage I've ever gotten and you can't beat the price... Especially in Vegas! I will be back for sure!

So this was my second time coming to this facility and let me say that the second time around was ten times better. And I KNOW that's mainly because I knew what to expect. So let me start this review by describing it through the eyes of a first timer.

(Cue in reminiscent music, pan in on face then fade out) I came here with my sister for Christmas 2012 as that was our Xmas present from my brother in law. He for sure wanted to have his wife and sis in law pampered so insisted we go to a spa. Being the glamazon princess that I am I pushed for Qua but my sister didn't want to break the bank on her hubby and pushed this place. I gave in as there is no sense in arguing. After all its a gift and I'll be appreciative no matter what or where it is. So off to Imperial Spa we go.

Now I've never been to a korean spa so had no clue what I was in for. With that said nor have I ever been to a naked bath house either and that's basically what I got. Not that that is a bad thing....it's just that I'm not used to seeing that many naked women in one setting...especially naked women that can pass for my mom and aunties. AWKWARD. So it was DEFINITELY initial shock. Naturally my sister and I were shy about being naked and walked around holding two 12x16 towels over our lady bits. But after being overwhelmed with the inundation of nakedness, my sister looked at me, exclaimed "Screw it!" and dropped trout. Due to her apparent "freedom" I shrugged and tossed the towel too. And there we were, the Naked Sisters, experiencing what the world would be like if clothes weren't invented. 

We decided to check out all our options. There were several SAUNA ROOMS: dry salt room, herbal room, salt room, and a dry room. We ventured in all four and I would have to say my favorite is the herbal room as you can smell the herbs. It was very relaxing if you can tolerate profusely sweating. Prior to enjoying the three different tubs--think of it as Goldilocks: cold, warm and hot--you're required to shower before entry. So there are showers equipped with shampoo, conditioner and soap dispensers. I used all three and all smelled lovely. 

We then ventured upstairs/2nd floor, which is the co-ed floor. Btw, you have to be clothed for the coed floor--this place is not that free love. There you'll find an exercise room, two media lounge areas with leather recliners and couches; the restaurant, skin/beauty/massage rooms, and three different DETOX ROOMS. I like to call them detox rooms as they are the following: red clay balls, jade, and red clay. They emit into your body releasing your toxins and promotes agelessness and function. Actually, just go on the website for a better accurate description as my review definitely is not medically approved. 

For additional costs, you can get other services--and no I'm not talking happy endings--head over to Chinatown for that. Sister got a bath scrub and I got a stone massage. 

So having returned for a second time last night with a girlfriend who isn't shy to bare all (caveat: groupon states that its recommended to be naked however upon check in it clearly states that it's REQUIRED to be in your birthday suit), we ventured in every area included in the day pass. My favorite experience was the red clay balls. I thoroughly enjoyed wiggling myself deeper and deeper into the miniature balls however try not to make too much noise as most of the areas are Quiet Zones and you WILL get looks. 

We did also eat at THE CAFE and ordered the beef bulgogi. The prices are expensive, the plate alone cost $18. However it does come with sides of kimchee, tofu, and seaweed. I wished, wished, wished I had my iphone with me so I could upload pictures of the food--it would make you want to eat the pictures! I was nosy enough to look at what the other patrons were eating and their food looked just as yummy. With that said, although pricey at least it will taste good. 

RECOMMENDATIONS:
In case they don't give you any sandals, bring some as the floors get extremely hot in particular on the co-ed floor. If you don't want to be bouncing around like a Russian dancer or one of the seven lords a-leaping or walking like a penguin, bring spa sandals. 

The locker room can get pretty cramped as there's only two "ottomans" centered there. There is a lounge area right by the lockers. I would suggest changing in there if the locker room does get clogged up. 

Come with an open mind and a mind that's ready to reach zen. 

OVERALL, I like this place. I like this place a lot. So much that my gf and I plan to come here at least once a month. I seriously could have fell asleep amongst the sea of red balls......its the following morning and I still feel so zen.

There's currently a groupon deal so I recommend purchasing it on groupon before going it's $21 for two person entry fee for one time. This spa is a hidden treasure grant it the exterior isn't as nice as the Mandarin but the amenities nonetheless are comparable for this price!!!! It's tucked away on the east side of the strip on Sahara. Their amenities include 6 rooms in which 4 are hot rooms made of stone jade, red clay, and Himalayan salt. These rooms are meant to regenerate your core and relieve any type of muscle pressure or pain in the joints. There is also a room designated specifically for yoga and it'll have a large screen where they show yoga videos. The last room I visit is the ice box room because you will sweat ur nuts off in all of them except for this one, it's literally an ice box. The spa also includes infinity pools and dry sauna and 2 steam rooms: herbal & sea salt. I love coming here with my girlfriends and spending a day just relaxing doing yoga in the hot rooms. We feel great after we leave. Did I mention the spa also has a small fitness room in which you can work out. It's a MUST GO!!!

This spa is for those who are serious about detoxing, relaxing, and want to do so in a clean and casual environment.  Daniel gives the best massage!  It's not your frilly kinda massage though.  It's the bootcamp of knuckle-kneading that delivers more relief to my aches and pains than any other massage I've encountered.  I usually don't go to male masseuses but he's fantastic, professional, and very skilled.  The facilities are lovely and I get a kick out of watching the Korean shows they have playing on various TVs.  (Don't worry, there are subtitles.)

This place never disappoints. I come to defrag & exhaaaaale & usually spend half a day here to soak up all the goodies. 
The hot & cold plunges, the steam rooms, sauna, detox rooms (clay,jade,igloo,infrared,yoga,etc,), all amazing and make me feel new again.

Overall this is a great place to detox and get away from it all for a while. I suggest wearing flip flops (or the sandals they provide) on the first floor, in the wet areas. It's nice to spend a little time in each room, Steam, Sauna, herbal sauna, etc., and just focus on letting go of all your stress. Enjoy!

This place is so amazing it has got me to yelp again. 

it reminded me of japanese onsen, except this is in vegas owned by koreans. 
They provide you with clothes to wear for the co-ed sauna area and 3 towels. 
This is especially awesome for cold winter days when you have nothing to do. Seriously, you can spend a whole day here. 
My favorite was the red clay ball sauna. It a room full of human size "litter boxes" full of these red clay balls. You lay on it, and it's like giving yourself your own massage. I definitely took a nap here. 

I recommend this place. I don't want them to close so everyone should go and experience a full day of relaxation. 
It's only $20 for locals for admission. totally worth every cent.

AFFORDABLE pricing than the spa spots on the vegas strip! I'm just going to get to the point since quite a few fellow yelpers explained clearly in their reviews what to expect from this korean spa. 

Pretty much for any korean spa you go to - the best services to get is the body scrub treatment. But I'm not comfortable yet having an ajumma giving me a full body scrub down butt nekkid. So I pass on that & the amenities as well for i'm more about the massages/treatments.

:: SPA SERVICES ::
So I came for the deep tissue massage & my gf had a facial treatment. Don't expect to get a bathrobe - it ain't the hotel spa. They do give you towels and a set of short/shirt to wear.  So you don't have to worry about going in a bath towel for your massage treatment - which i'm sure you could if you wanted to?! The massage treatment rooms are downstairs and the facial treatment is upstairs on the Co-Ed floor. Patricia was my masseuse & she did an outstanding job. She really got to my knots & double checked to make sure the pressure was ok throughout the hour. I think there was even a moment or so that I almost fell asleep! I know my gf said she did in her facial treatment :) That's how relaxing & enjoyable our treatments were~


:: FOOD ::
OMG I must say that i was surprised that the food we had here was actually really good. We ordered Bibimbap & Galbi Tang. Both were made just perfect and it was so tasty! We were given 3 banchans & they were hella good too!  As for pricing I must say it'd definitely on the pricier end but still worth it. There are hot/cold water dispenser by the cafe bar (located on the co-ed floor) too. Plenty of seating of your choice.


:: DRAWBACKS ::
The only negative I have is that it was pretty warm all around the whole place - especially the bathrooms (definitely no ventilation in there!). The only spot that was nice & cool was the lobby area =\  Maybe it's just me? 


:: NOTES ::
1) Not that easy to find for it's not visible off the Saraha strip
2) The front desk area do provide complimentary toothbrushes & razors
3) There are kids here that family's do bring so don't be surprised seeing them
4) slippers  can be requested from the front desk just know you aren't suppose to
     wear the slippers to the Co-Ed room
5) smoking patio is upstairs to the left of the cafe side where the dining area is

My bf and i, we were pretty excited to find a Korean spa in Vegas. But we were really disappointed with this place. First of all, i dont think its clean enough for people to walk into the restrooms barefoot. The foods were ok. The Korean, they are known for their awesome side dishes and even though they gave us some, but it wasnt up to my expectation. The ambience of a spa wasnt there, broken recliner chairs, not enough vent to get rid of the food smell in from the kitchen. I was really disappointed.

I've visited this spa a few times and always recommend it when friends and family come to town. Today, I recommended this spa to a friend visiting, he LOVED the massage with Tyler. He gets frequent massages and says this she was fantastic, one of the best ever, and he booked himself for another massage during his visit. I will be heading back there soon too!

Love coming here... Seriously drove 300 miles out of our way to enjoy a spa day. I come from Montana to Vegas about twice a year, and a stop to the imperial spa is always a must! My only criticism is that I wish they would get a face cradle for the massage table.. My neck tends to get very tight from being wedged to one side for so long, but the therapist usually notices and gives me a good neck rub to follow. The place is spotless and it is truly an oasis away from the noise and rush of the strip.

This place USED to be GREAT!  Today in women's area 1 steam room not working, jacuzzi Luke warm + not as clean as usual - foamy, heavy chemical smell, & upstairs terribly strong odor of frying fish. I would have had lunch there but left - couldn't tolerate the smell!!!

Cool place. Very clean. i had a issue with guys in the mens room. it was super shady. i could tell 2 guys inside had weird intentions and that made me pissed. so i flaunted my package and made them move on. The whole gay thing does not bother me. but if you keep starring at me i get a little annoyed and pissed off. i would definitely go again. but be aware of gay guys looking at your wiener.

Prior to moving to Las Vegas I had never heard of a Korean spa but after I saw a groupon for it, I had to check it out. Since my first visit I have returned several times with friends, and everyone has always had a great time. It's pretty inexpensive, even without the groupon. My favorite rooms are the Himalayan salt room, the clay ball room, and the ice room. It's extremely clean and even when I've been there later in the evening, staff are cleaning. I have never eaten here, but the shave ice looks good. The only negative thing I can think of, is that the lounge chairs in the upstairs area don't all work, but that's pretty minor. 

If you are looking for an inexpensive, fun way to relax with friends or even alone, check this place out - and check groupon first, there is almost always a groupon!

I've visited this spa multiple times and I have to say it never seems really up to par. This visit in specific seemed to have many cleanliness issues. Both saunas were very slimy feeling on the floors, and the amount of dirty towels and clothes around the men's area was pretty bad. There were no clean towels available, and as a very frequent spa visitor towels get wet after a few sauna visits. Draping a wet towel around you isn't always the most comfortable thing to do.
As for the hot tub, I wasn't to impressed and the fact that there were black dirty spots inside the rim of the walls was not a pleasant site to see. I'm not sure how often they are cleaned but I do know any pool or hot tub should not have dirt rings on the walls. 

I will however give the third star due to the cost of spa, the dry rooms were very warm and relaxing also very clean. Coed was especially clean.  I will probably visit again but it definitely wont be for a while, and next time I really hope to see the cleanliness of the wet areas to be better. 

TO THE OWNERS, we as customers to you are all NAKED. How would you feel if you saw dirt and slime everywhere and your naked skin was surrounded by it. GET IT TOGETHER OWNERS!!!! I'm sure your private homes are not as gross as some of these conditions were.

I didn't know this was a nekid spa. I did it anyways! Why?! Because it's Vegas! (And because I paid for it before knowing what was to come) It was an accidentally pleasant and interesting experience.   

If you can get over it (being nude), this is a really fun and inexpensive place for a spa day! We used the groupon deal which was a steal! I gave them 5 stars because you can't beat $21 dollars for two people for all day access to their spa facilities. They provide things like spa clothes, sandals, soap, shampoo, conditioner, a toothbrush, a razor, lotions, hair dryers and water bottles. We started off using the different sauna rooms. Also tried the clay toom, jade room and ice room. They also have a yoga room. For a Friday morning it was very quiet and peaceful. 

After we got a feel for the place we decided to purchase a 70 min body scrub plus massage for only $120 a person. A steal considering how much it cost to do the same anywhere else on the strip. It took a little bit of courage considering you have to be nude in front of all these strangers. There are no clothes allowed in the pools, wet saunas, showers and treatment rooms. They require you to shower or sit in the sauna for 10 minutes to soften your skin before a body scrub. They scrub every inch of your body that you can imagine. THAT. YOU. CAN. IMAGINE. Massage was great for tiny little women! They are way stronger that they look. The package also came with a facial mask and shampoo massage. Felt super squeaky clean and relaxed afterwards!

They also serve Korean food and drinks in the common area upstairs.  I ordered KBBQ and shrimp fried rice to end the day there. Not sure if it was delicious or if I was just starving, but it felt like the best meal of my life at the time. Who wouldn't want to gorge yourself with Korean food after spending hours getting pampered!!?

I would absolutely return!
Be totally ok being in the nude and seeing other people of your gender in the nude. Come on don't be shy,you ain't got nothing I never seen before.

This is a great place to spend some time to relax in. Quiet clean rooms and a generally relaxing environment. I also used their massage/body scrub package and it was good. The only reason I'm not giving it a five, is that I felt the service was slightly overpriced.
Relax, naked, cleaning, refresh body and mind here! Heavenly!
This is the paradise...  I don't know any other place dose Korean style body scrab.  I can stay all day here...

This is my first experience on an actual spa, let alone a Korean Bathhouse. It was a different but good experience for me. My boyfriend took me for my birthday yesterday and it was such a much needed "gift". He has been here before and raved about it. Going in, I didn't know what to expect but it was really clean inside. He let me choose what package I wanted, I ended up getting the aroma-therapy scrub and massage which was 90 minutes and $150.00. He got the swedish massage which is a mild massage for the men, if you get the deep tissue expect it to be a bit rough. When buying the package a man was complaining about this massage, stating he must've bought the wrong package. There's a woman's area, & mens, and they provide clothes for you to change into.
There's saunas and hot tubs, beware ladies A LOT of nudity but in your area. At first I wasn't so comfortable, but seeing how everyone was naked in the woman's area, I adjusted. Finally my massage came and found me in the hot tub area. The aroma scrub was delightful, she scrubbed away all my "dead skin", and even asked if I wanted to avoid my tattoo areas, I told her to go gentle in that area. Even though she didn't speak English that well, she was kind, we communicated well, made me feel comfortable because I was naked throughout this whole scrub / massage. Washed, and cleaned, and went onto the massage. I think I even fell asleep, it was a great experience. I also got a facial, and my hair shampoo and conditioned. I felt like a whole new woman, and RELAXED! I'm still relaxed lol.

Nice Staff, clean, and well worth the time and money.

P.S. There is a common area where there is lazy leather boy chairs, and a big screen t.v. and also an area where you can watch movies. I have to say this was a great gift! My boyfriend will have me raving for months, or until next time ;]

Pros: 
sauna and spa! One star
Working rooms on 2nd floor One star
Restaurant reopened

Cons:
Not working great shower head - where is pressure?
Bad water temperature on men's spa
Chlorine used on women's spa... a lot at that.... tearing eyes
Restaurant too expensive... price went up again....

First of all I'd like to mention that I used to live in South Korea for a year and used to go to Korean Spas very often. I was super happy when I found this place in Las Vegas!
USED to go to this spa pretty often with my friends, but after visiting last time on 7/18/2016 unfortunately NOT GONNA COME BACK!
The staff was extremely unhelpful and don't bother with asking to talk to a manager
Mr. William Chang , he was rude and absolutely didn't try to find a solution.
The story:
I bought a few groupons for this spa (as like I said, used to go to this place often) but suddenly I had to fly to another country for a couple months because of family issue my mom got very sick). By the time I've got back the groupons were still working for me but I didn't use them all in time because I had to fly back to my family again. So I went to SPA on May 1 and ask if there is anything they could do for me so I'm not loosing my money and they were so helpful and understanding that they gave me vouchers for all my groupons that they were good till sept 2016 and some good till even 2018 year!!! I was extremely happy. 
I am back to LV now and yesterday 7/18/2016 went to SPA with friends but didn't end up using the facility at all. As soon as I pulled vouchers out of my bag the man at the reception right away said: WE DON'T EXCEPT THIS ANYMORE! Even the expiration day was sep 2016,they refused to let us use the facility except we would pay, but I already paid for it!!! 
While we tried to find any solution the manager Mr. William Chang came out of his office and started talking to me, but he didn't even try to find a solution to satisfy us as customers. First of all he said that vouchers I have they were giving for free and couldn't been given to me instead of groupon! and they've stopped excepting those since May 11 anyway. WHAT?? 
After long explanation and telling my story to a manager he said: All I can do for you today  is you pay for one visit and can go 2 people! it's my final offer, he said!
I'm sorry: final offer??? I didn't hear any other offers, that was the only offer he made! In which case why would I agree to that offer, if I already paid for the visit?! Not to mention he was speaking with a very rude tone to me and didn't even try to understand the situation. In fact he didn't even try to listen. He even was back to his office without saying anything, so I had to ask him to come back again! And then finally after all my trials to prove him my point, he said he doesn't believe me, so I asked if he is calling me a LIAR? His response was: ACTUALLY, YES YOU ARE LYING TO ME.
Later one of his staff said that manager didn't call me a liar, that was some kind of misunderstanding!
I wasn't alone there, I have people who heard what I've heard!

Also I still have about 7 more vouchers as deals from groupon were for 1,2 and 4 persons.  
The SPA manager told me that I have to talk to groupon if I have any issues. The whole reason I went to this spa in may and agreed to those vouchers it's because there was an expiration date at the groupon deal so I was trying to find a solution to not loose my money. But the SPA manager said that groupon never expires, he didn't even want to look at my groupon account while I was trying to show him to prove that expiration date does exist!

VERY DISAPPOINTED!!! I DON'T KNOW WHAT HAPPENED WITH THIS PLACE, BUT SEEMS LIKE THEY DON'T CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS ANYMORE!

P.S. Not that I didn't get chance to relax at the spa I've got stressed out because of visiting this place! Ridiculous!!!

This is my place to unwind. After a week of work and the added stress if you have any or just want some down time, soak in the jacuzzi, sit is the steam room or sauna or maybe lay in the jade room. Men and women are separate and you can find discounted vouchers on living social and groupon. The restaurant is pretty good but pricy. Its clean and opens late as well. Be ready to be nude and walk around with a towel. No on judges.

I love this place almost for everything, but the shower area can be improved.  Most of the shower heads are clogged and/or out of use.  And I often see people brush their teeth at shower area...gross!
First time here... had the best massage therapy given by angela.. I had the best relaxin time ever...

Can't imagine ever going back under any Circumstance. If u are a str8 male this is not the place for u . Too many penises walking around or sitting around legs open inviting u to look.  The "must be naked "rule to use the spa is over the top. Too queer for me . There is a reason the $20 entry fee is NON-Refundable. Enjoy !!!!!

I love Korean spas and this one proved to me to be one that I will keep coming back to! I really enjoyed my scrub/massage. The gal giving it to me was very good. I did not feel like I was rushed through it. I was a little disappointed that there were only 2 hot tubs and 1 cold tub to soak in. The hot tubs were a bit too hot for me so I had to keep plunging in the cold tub to cool off. I'm used to Korean spas that have 6 pools of all varying temperatures plus mug wart rinsing stations etc. was pleasantly surprised with the herbal sauna. I think that was my favorite. I ate in their tiny restaurant. Had marinated beef. it was kind of like bulgogi. It was okay, not the best but then i wasn't expecting it to be the best. The spa was pretty much empty, about 7 women came through while I was there, all Korean (which I think is a great sign) Upstairs in the coed section there were 4 men (all Korean) All in all I had a fabulous day and will be going back. I am so glad i am local and its not too far from my home. I definitely recommend this place it is a jewel in the desert!

Part 2: You'll be smiling and skipping after this meal. My tummy was beyond happy and all I could say is ahhhhhhhh! Last call for orders is 9:30p.m. and to get anything, just ring the bell by the water dispenser. I also like their Sikhye (sweet Korean rice cold drink) for when you're feeling dizzy or low on sugar. This will definitely help you replenish! And if you have room for dessert, their snow ice fruit dessert is ginormous in serving size! So good in cooling you down.

I skip the mud ball room, but if I have time, I'll stay a few minutes in the red clay eskimo room. The rooms upstairs are extremely hot and it wasn't like that a few years ago. Afterwards, I'll go take a shower and call it a night. I use the big body towel at the very end to dry myself and my hair. I use the smaller towel for whenever I'm sitting down inside the steam rooms, scrubbing myself, wash it, use it upstairs over the pillows to help me stay cool, and finally after I'm done taking a shower, I wash it again, ring the excess water, and pre dry myself before heading to my locker to change. I do bring my own face and body lotion to use after I changed into my regular clothes. I'll put my towels in the hamper and my used tshirt/shorts in the hamper on the locker side. They do have signs on where to put what, but nobody seems to keep it together here. I also bring a gatorade drink to get my electrolytes back into my body after sweating so much. I drink it after every sweat session to keep me hydrated. There are water dispensers by the lockers and upstairs by the yoga room. 

For men, be careful with wandering eyes and lurky hands. My Father's best friend had someone lay right next to him and waited until he fell asleep to grab his you know what and when my dad witnessed this, he yelled.. you crazy! I also had a woman that was coloring her damn hair at this spa and when I was taking a shower at the end, she was rinsing it off next to me. All that black dye was spraying all over my legs! I was not a happy camper. 

Overall, this is the only place in Vegas that offers so many amenities and delicious, authentic Korean food. I wish they would open another one in the west side of town! Love getting my sweat on, detox my toxins away, and reeeeelaxing!

My first Korean spa experience and it was amazing.  Love love love the salt dry sauna and herbal sauna.  Relaxing getaway, sweat, soak, shower and nap all day!  You get your own comfy wear and there are separate male/female, co-ed facilities.  Very clean, well kept, and not over crowded.

Finally got to check this place out and I can say that I'm upset that I haven't  gone here years ago! Oh... those brutal days of skiing and hiking - I'd definitely feel much better after if I went to this place :)

Anyways... it was Tuesday night and there were only like 3-4 guys in there. 

+ Place is clean and well maintained.
+ Towels, robes and even razors, toothbrushes provided
+ Red clay ball room is great. Just bury yourself in rocks :)
+ There's a small gym, movie room and even cafe upstairs.

Bottom line: it may end up on my weekly list of things to do

WARNING: If you are not a fan of eastern spas DO NOT GO HERE. If you are, then this is the place for you.

The Imperial Health Spa has a variety of pools, steam rooms, sauna rooms, and even mineral rooms for meditation. It's not your froo-froo western spa with $50 slippers or extremely plush robes. You will be given an over-sized pair of shorts and t-shirt with rubber slippers that will compliment nothing. 

This place is massive unlike your typical Burke Williams. Customers range from Americans to wrinkly Korean women doing some kind of Tai Chi from station to station. I love the Herbal Steam Room! There isn't really an official order (pool-sauna-steam-etc) so feel free to roam around and test things out. Upstairs you will find all the mineral and clay sauna rooms. My favorite is the clay ball room. TIP: Bring a towel with you as some of these rooms can get really hot. My favorite is doing some Bikram while in the Jade Room.

Massages are decent. Disappointed that they don't do combos. If you find a place that will do it: The best combo is Thai and Shiatsu then end with 15 minutes Swedish.

Namaste!

HEALTH HAZARD WARNING It is absolutely shocking how much mold is in there!!! Dirty towels, floors, and lockers. Raggedy t-shirts. No attendants. Imagine leaving a spa after just a few minutes smh 0stars

I cut my teeth on the Korean bath house experience during my frequent business travels to Asia. It was there that I learned to overcome any residual American victorian reserve about spending time naked in water with fellow business associates. As a voluptuous non-asian from a cheese-eating nation, my naked form stood out from the lithe Asian locals in the locker room like a lolly pop pulled from its stick. I spent my first visit trying to keep the small towel strategically placed on my flora and fauna_ as not to offend. That was a long time ago, and I have since come to love this communal bath experience that has spoiled me forever. Today I can saunter about a locker room or mineral spring butt naked with more gusto than Will Ferrel's famous streak in the movie Old Skool.

Qua... Oh Nua, Forget overpriced hotel spa rubs that annoy with Enya music and slather you with rancid oil used to fry buffet fare. I 've come to rely on the Asian bath house experience as a way to heal and regenerate regularly. At Imperial, the hot and cold plunges are only outdone by a golden jade sauna and clay room_great for  getting your meditation on. Imperial Spa has provided me with a local fix for this once exotic travel indulgence, right here in LV 24/7. Katherine is an amazing healer and massage therapist, and good homestyle Korean food rounds out your visit.   

To quote Ru Paul " You're born naked, you die naked, and everything inbetween is just drag"

Service - Friendly.  Everyone said hello and greeted you. 

Food - We had the spicy beef soup and bulgogi.  Great price but average on taste.

Facilities - No frills type of place.  No robes or sandals were provided.  Upon check-in, you receive a t-shirt, shorts, locker key, hand cloth and bath towel.   The scrubs were expensive as compared to other place and they use what feels like a dish scrub which was more rough than what other places use. 

Suggestion - Please post what the benefits are for using each room!

OMG, this place is really crawling with non-Koreans!  Oh - wait...*looking in the mirror*... well, anyway, it's a really diverse clientele here.  If you're like me and don't look Korean, you won't get stared at at all.  I'm from southern California and came here while on a short stay here in Vegas.  It wasn't easy for tourists to find, and I'm guessing the clientele was mostly locals.  I'm glad I got there early.  At that time, I nearly had the bathing section to myself and the ratio of Koreans to non-Koreans was 1:1.  By the time I was leaving (around 4 pm), it was 1 Korean : 2 non-Koreans and it got busy.  I guess there aren't that many Koreans in Vegas.

The bathing section had weird hooks hanging from the ceiling.  At first, I was a bit confused about the knobs for tubs' jets.  The seated showers were a ways off from the standing ones.  My favorite part of the bathing section was the herbal steam room.  Bath towels were large enough to wrap around my body, unlike at most other K-spas.

The coed area was upstairs.  It sure looked nice up there.  Its main lounging area and the restrooms there were really cold though, so I never felt the need to try the ice sauna there.  Also, compared to other K-spas, these saunas took longer to make me sweat.  I guess what I liked best upstairs was the free wifi (an access code is posted at the snack bar), because all these places in Vegas are so stingy and want to charge for wifi.  I take free wifi for granted back home in So Cal.  The main problem I had upstairs was that the shorts of my PJs kept falling down - they were huge and the elastic wasn't snug enough to hold them up.

Apparently, they allow babies here.  As I left, a woman was taking her baby into the bath section.  At least his or her diaper was still on.  I don't think saunas and steam rooms are safe for babies, and I sure wouldn't want them in communal bathwater...also babies aren't put into showers, but rather into little baby bathtubs at home.  I can see parents wanting to go to a spa, but they should hire a babysitter first, leave the baby with them, and then go.  I also saw this Korean family (granny, 2 adult daughters and a 3 yr. old granddaughter) come into the sauna of the bathing area.  The little granddaughter hated it and was throwing a fit, so they all left soon after they got there.  This isn't really a place for little kids or babies, and I felt like a perv being naked with a grown woman's body (big boobs, hairy bush) in front of a little kid like her.

Thank goodness the cleaning lady here wasn't hovering near me when I was getting ready to leave like they tend to do at some of these other places, and yet the place was kept clean without her being underfoot or in the way.

I loved the Labelle treatment! Joanne was wonderful! My skin feels new again! 

I liked that the scrub was done in a private room. I've been to Korean spas where the scrub is done in a common room with no privacy. If you don't mind walking around in your birthday suit, you'll enjoy it. I wore a towel as I moved about, because I don't have the body that I used to have decades ago.

My only complaint would be that I had to look for my attendant 5 minutes after my appointment was scheduled to start, and that they do not provide robe and slippers. The short set they gave me was too tight.

I really like this place, it is peaceful and has many wonderful sauna choices. My favorite is the red clay ball room where you lie in a pit of tiny heated red balls while you relax in the dim, quiet atmosphere. I have gone there several times with friends and I highly recommend it!

This review is for all you Westerners out there!  You'd be wise to read this review to understand what you're in for here.

The good
Clean, spacious, and inexpensive.
A number of different options with steam rooms, treatments, etc.
Jacuzzi was perfect temperature and water press was good everywhere.

Okay, the strange and unusual
First, they allow kids in this place, and there were a number of rug rats running around.  I don't feel particularly good with 6 year olds that aren't my issue running around at schwantz level looking at my crotch area.  Might be cool in other cultures, but definitely queers the vibe.
Second, they have a restaurant located on the second floor.  Didn't try any of the food, but I'm not a huge fan of smelling kalbi while I'm trying to relax after a steam shower.  Food is a good idea, I just wouldn't have anything cooked to serve.  
Third, this is a Korean spa, so all the televisions are on Korean channels, whose programming is strange.  Would like to have seen more screens for all the new years day bowl games.
Finally, because this is Korean joint, all the men(and woman according to my girlfriend who also visited the woman's spa) do not shave, so it looks like a jeri curl convention in there, which is also unattractive.  Massage I got was pretty good, but not cheap at 90.00 for an off strip joint.  I get 45 dollar Thai massages here in LA that blow away every massage I've ever had around the world, some costing up to 200 bucks.

I used to really enjoy this place, but they have made many bad changes within the past several months.  They give you a regular towel and a small towel--period.  They used to have extra towels in the locker rooms--not anymore.  You end up trying to dry yourself off with a wet towel--that's not even sanitary.  They used to have shaving soap and razors--not anymore.  There was no attendant, either, so nobody was cleaning.  I went in the morning and they only had one employee for the entire place.  He was very nice, but if a woman had an issue, she would have been out of luck.  The steam room had steam, but it wasn't hot at all--just warm.  They also have a new rule where you have to wear the uniform in certain parts of the locker room, so you would have to keep putting clothes on and taking them off. I know that they are trying to stop people from doing inappropriate things, but if they had an attendance walking around, that wouldn't be an issue.  It seems to me that they have made all of these changes to save money, but now it doesn't seem like a Korean spa anymore.  Unless they change back, I will not be returning.

I love this spa! This spa is my hideaway in vegas and it's CLEAN.
You can spend hours in here,but be careful not to get sucked into the Korean soaps or you'll stay there all day.

Well managed $20 entrance fee Korean spa. 

Located in a sketchy area of Vegas, which means park near the entrance in well-lit area, take your valuables, lock your car. 

1st floor is separate Men's and Women's showers/baths, all nude. Management prohibits wearing swimsuits in the jacuzzies (women, do what you want). You must shower before using the baths too. HYGIENE! 

This is not a "men's" (code for gay) spa, this is a legitimate spa, and they have signs posted throughout clearly stating "no lewd behavior, you will be thrown out". 

Entrance is $20. Yes, $20. With that you use the whole facility as long as you want. 
They're open from the morning till 11pm everyday. 

1st floor is hot jacuzzi, cold plunge pool, stand-up and sit down showers, aromatherapy steam room, dry sauna, salt sauna. 

Locker/disposable razors/shave cream/toothbrushes/toothpaste/shower gel/shampoo/conditioner/hair brushes/After Shave/hair gel/large towel/small towels/lounging pajamas/all provided. 

Slippers are $5/pair or bring your own. You cannot wear your street shoes inside, shoe locker is provided. 
I recommend slippers, some of the sauna room floors are hot on your feet; you'll thank me later. 

2nd floor is coed, and you must wear your lounging pajamas here. 
2nd floor are two types of Red Clay saunas, Jade sauna, the Ice Room, reclining chairs, 2 flat screen TVs playing Korean soap operas, WiFi, massage chairs that take dollar bills if you want to use them. 

The restaurant here is permanently closed as of April 17, 2016 says management. 

Overall, the facility is clean and well maintained.
 
$20 is all you pay. 
$20, such a deal. 

They offer all types of massages with appointment at the standard prices. 

I'll be going back. 
I recommend for rest and relaxation.

I love coming here for relaxation. Its definitely a hit or miss as far as how busy it can be. Definitely more popular during the cold winter months versus hot summer days. 
Tips- Be prepared to be naked in all male/female locker room and shower stalls. They give you a uniform to wear in the common area where the different relaxation rooms are at. Food is good too.. a little pricey compared to regular restaurant but homemade good.
Very clean very easy to get around the restaurant is closed on Wednesday other than that it would have been 5 stars!

i love this place!!!!! 
$20 to all day (until midnight) access to the spa... SUPER clean... as for the employees you cant understand a word they say but thats just because i am american and they all speak korean lol... love love love this place... going to buy the 10 time access card next week! super relaxing!

The spa is very clean but I personally prefer more "pretty" places. This is a very pragmatic place. It feels institutional to me. When I come here, it's to get a treatment and to hangout for a few minutes in the co-ed areas. Then I leave. I enjoy the clay ball rooms a little. I don't zen out on them like other people. To me it's more of a novelty. I wouldn't make a day out of a visit here. It's just not luxurious enough for me. A few hours is plenty.

But with that said, this is a very big facility with a lot of good things going. My recommendation is to pay for a spa service and use the facilities as an added bonus. I get scrubbed shiny with the Body Massage Scrub for $120. My skin is always super smooth with all the dead stuff sloughed off when the treatment is done.

Yes, yes. You get naked for the majority of the time you're here. I think this is more bothersome to the men I know who've been here. Something about bathing with other naked men. Oh... get over it! Naked is good. Naked should happen more often with no sexual intent.

RELAXATION.  This spa blew me away!  I was very impressed on how clean and huge this place was. Please note that there is a lot of NUDITY (your own sex of course) and if you're okay with that then this place will not let you down.  I loved the the hot tub, warm tub and cold tub.  There is a variety of saunas which include both wet and dry.  I like to alternate my time in each.  My personal favorites were the wet salt sauna, dry salt sauna and the clay dome sauna.  The clay dome sauna felt like a bunch of little caves and you can have one all to yourself.  It may make some feel claustrophobic, but I actually enjoyed it.  I felt like it was my escape from the world.  There was even an ice room, which surprisingly I enjoyed.  I felt like every muscle in my body was able to relax here.  You sweat a lot too, so I felt like I was clearing out my pores and doing something beneficial for my skin.  They have shampoo, conditioner and shower gel by each of their showers.  My skin can tend to be sensitive and neither one of their products irritated me at all which was a huge plus.  Also please make sure to shower before getting into any of the tubs.  It's a courtesy thing.  I must have showered at least 3 times when I was there.  I have to say even the showers feel amazing.  The water pressure is excellent.

They do offer spa services which have received tons of great reviews.  I do plan on doing some of them.  The packages sound excellent and then you can spend the whole day using the facilities.  The admittance cost was ridiculously affordable too!  I'll be sure to be back soon.

This place is a heaven. An absolute heaven. It's a flat fee for unlimited use of the premises, which are absolutely beautiful and very clean. Marble floors, marble walls, leather barcaloungers. The hot rooms are my favorite, especially the room with the heated clay balls. It's an adult version of the ball pit at Chuck E. Cheese, minus the snot. Bonus: the heat gives you a legit natural high, which you can bask in as you watch Korean soap operas in the lounge. You can add treatments & massages if you like. Downstairs is the woman only spot, where you get naked. I loved the showers where you sit. Used those multiple times, as is proper etiquette.

Is it weird that hanging out here with my best friend naked all day is now among my top 3 memories? Maybe. I am really bummed that on my next visit I won't be able to come here, because I am with child & the hot rooms are a big pregnant lady no-no. I mean, sanctity of motherhood, beauty of life, blah blah etc, but for fuck's sake, I want to rub myself in a pit of balls!

I went to this spa at the recommendation of a friend who had been here before. 

I've previously been to jeju Korean spa in Atlanta, GA, so I had high expectations that this would be similar. It's not quite the same but it's kind of like a baby sister version, if that makes sense. (A bit smaller and less saunas upstairs.)

You check in at the front desk and get the spa clothing--my bottoms were too small and the replacement bigger size I got were still a little snug. I'm not sure if they go bigger than what I had but if you are a larger size customer I would call ahead to find out what size they offer and if you can bring your own clothing.

I couldn't tell from the website but if you pay for a massage you get the day spa access included, which makes the big price of the massage much more worth it. 

There are at least two steam rooms (one salt, one herbal) downstairs in the women's bath area, complimentary razors, toothbrushes and toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner and shower gel included. I would bring your own face masks and scrubs if you have them. 

The upstairs has several hot rooms, a red clay stone thingy where you lay in a bunch of rocks, a room with a yoga workout projected on a screen and two areas where you can hang out in recliners watching TV (one was on a Korean channel and one was on English speaking channel). 

I had the spicy pork bbq for lunch--it was pricey at $15 but came with several side dishes. The ginger tea was excellent.

I got a 90 minute deep tissue massage and it was pretty good. Not the best I've had but overall contributed to a relaxing day at the spa.

This is a decent Korean Spa.  I am spoiled from Los Angeles and New Jersey Korean Spas but this place isn't so bad.  

They are closed for renovation right now.  Check with their website or call before heading out there.  They are located a little out of ways from the strip and it was a waste of time going there because they are closed indefinitely for now.

Best korean Spa that I ever attended in US.
I would recommend spa goers to check that place if you have some time.
P.S.
And yes you have to get NAKED at some point.So if you have issue with that, probably it's not your type of spa.

Stay away from this place!

I can see this place being nice when it first opened but that was not the case when I was there on September 30, 2016. I used a Groupon and paid $14 instead of the regular $20 facility fee. 

This review is only for the facility. My girlfriend and I flew into Vegas for The Chainsmokers at Hakkasan Friday night and had a flight home the next morning at 6:20am so we wanted to relax at the spa a bit and have a place to get ready. 

This place was gross. The showers were dirty and the sinks all had hair in them. Half of the showers didn't work or were broken (spraying water in odd directions). The hot tub & warm tub temps were the same and both had a heavy chlorine/chemical smell. Half the lights above the sinks were out so not the best lighting for applying makeup. We were already in our way out at 10 but they announced over the speaker system that the spa was closing in 1 hour but the website states the hours are till 11:30pm. 

Never coming back here and DO NOT recommend to anyone.

This was my third time visiting the Imperial Health Spa.  I bought a single person pass from GROUPON for $12.00.   You can stay all day and enjoy the facilities upstairs and downstairs.

O.K.  First things first.   The downstairs area is separated by sex.  Men go in one room, women go in another room.   The pools, jacuzzi, steam rooms, saunas are ALL NUDE!  No bathing suits, no clothes.   So if you're super shy - this is NOT the place for you.

The place is very clean and the people are very nice.   I'm a big lady (200 lbs) so I was a little nervous at first about the "nude" part, but nobody made me feel uncomfortable about my size.    I love the jacuzzi pool (warm) (largest of the three pools).  They also have a hot pool and a cold pool.

My absolute favorite is the HERBAL STEAM ROOM.   Smells so good and feels wonderful.

Upstairs is CO-ED.   When you check into the spa they give you towels, slippers, and a pair of shorts and a t-shirt.   You wear the shorts/t-shirt upstairs.

They have a place to eat, but I haven't eaten there -- too pricey for me.

This review is based mostly on the facial that I received by Marina. I received the vitamin C facial and I really felt like she did a good job of tightening up my pores and having the products penetrate my face.

However, there were some gripes I had. The facial was supposed to be for 1hr and 15 min and it was more like 1hour. It probably would have been if she was more slower and thorough during her massage. It was was nice and replacing, just wished she slowed her tempo a bit. She's not too gentle, but her hands are very experienced and knows what they're doing. Also, at the end of the facial, instead of a glowing, my face was slathered on w/ oil, that made me look like I was drowned in it.

The facilities has probably seen better days. Doesn't look like they are doing a good job of upkeep. The chances of me returning are pretty slim. I'll just stick w/ Korean spas in SoCal.
Very spacious,very clean. Great enjoyment for the price. Not to mention that you can get their spring special like I just did, which is 10 admissions for $120.
A hidden gem. Very nice amenities and reasonably priced. I definitely recommend this place for some good old R&R!

The other day my boyfriend asks me, "What are you going to do today?" (It was my day off and my daughter is on vacation) I replied, "I dunno.  Stuck between some European lady giving me a facial and a middle-aged Korean woman scrubbing the top 5 layers of my skin off."



I decided to go with the Korean woman and Imperial Health Spa.  Imperial is tucked away in a less than ritzy part of Las Vegas on Sahara East of the Strip.  Keep an eye out for the signs or you might miss it.

I had come here on recommendation from a couple sets of friends (some local and some tourists that found this place on Yelp.)  They are open 24 hours if you just want to use the saunas and what not for $20 admission (I honestly am not sure how the overnight admission works)

I came here specifically for a Body Scrub & Massage ($90) and was kind of disappointed to find out (after I had been there for 5 hours) that for $5 more I could have "upgraded" to a salt scrub or some kind of fruit scrub.  Oh well... now I know for next time.

You kind of have to do a little reading to figure this place out so that you don't walk in there expecting one thing and getting another.

What to expect:
-Clean facilities.
-Korean tv blasting EVERYWHERE
-Tough love type of massage (the kind that hurts good)
-Husky Korean lady in lacey bra and panty set (that would be your scrub technician/masseuse, Joanne)
-Nudity. Lots of it.

Cool Perks:
-Theater room
-Juice bar and Restaurant (I really liked the food, and the fact that I could take my leftovers to go... That spicy tofu soup made an awesome midnight snack... Prices rance between $7 and $15 but portions are pretty big for 1 person)
-Exercise room (even though the treadmills were out of comission)


The Saunas were different and although I read the descriptions of each of them I still didn't really feel any difference between them. (Salt Sauna, Jade Sauna, Red Clay Sauna, Red Clay Ball Sauna, Cedar Sauna).  I kind of felt bad in the Red Clay Ball Sauna because some lady was snoring away and I kind of accidentally spilled a bunch of the teeny tiny clay balls on the tile floor as I was trying to get out of my Clay Ball Bed.

There were 2 steam rooms: a Salt one (awesome...bucket of salt you could use to exfoliate... and for some reason a lot hotter than the other steam room) and an Herbal one, which didnt smell too herby.

I liked the 3 tubs Hot, Warm and super icy Cold.  Something refreshing about stepping from a hot tub to totally submerging yourself in an icy cold bath.


Bottom Line:
Prepare well for your trip to Imperial.  Enjoy a few hours (I did 5 and a half... could have easily stayed longer).  Bring gym shoes (if you want) and some reading material. Try the food.  Get a scrub. Not in that order.
